Variables

const BmType volatilityTypeMap
 
const set< string > validInterps = {"Linear", "LinearFlat", "BackwardFlat", "Cubic", "CubicFlat"}
 
const string xccyCurveNamePrefix = "__XCCY__"
 

Compare <code>CorrelationFactor</code>s.

typedef std::pair< CorrelationFactor, CorrelationFactor > CorrelationKey
 
bool operator< (const CorrelationFactor &lhs, const CorrelationFactor &rhs)
 
bool operator== (const CorrelationFactor &lhs, const CorrelationFactor &rhs)
 
bool operator!= (const CorrelationFactor &lhs, const CorrelationFactor &rhs)
 
ostream & operator<< (std::ostream &out, const CorrelationFactor &f)
 Allow CorrelationFactors to be written. More...
 
CorrelationFactor parseCorrelationFactor (const string &name)

◆ CalibrationType

enum CalibrationType
strong

Supported calibration types.

Enumerator
Bootstrap 

Choose this option if the component's calibration strategy is expected to yield a perfect match of model to market prices. For example, this can be achieved when calibrating an IR component to a series of co-terminal swaptions with given mean reversion speed and piecewise volatility function (alpha) where jump times coincide with expiry dates in the swaption basket. Similarly, when calibrating an FX component to a series of FX Options. The calibration routine will throw an exception if no perfect match is achieved.

BestFit 

Choose this if no perfect match like above can be expected, for example when an IR component with constant parameters is calibrated to a basket of swaptions. The calibration routine will consequently not throw an exception when the match is imperfect.

None 

No calibration

Definition at line 53 of file lgmdata.hpp.

53  {
54  /*! Choose this option if the component's calibration strategy is expected to
55  yield a perfect match of model to market prices. For example, this can be
56  achieved when calibrating an IR component to a series of co-terminal
57  swaptions with given mean reversion speed and piecewise volatility
58  function (alpha) where jump times coincide with expiry dates in the swaption
59  basket. Similarly, when calibrating an FX component to a series of FX Options.
60  The calibration routine will throw an exception if no perfect match is
61  achieved.
62  */
63  Bootstrap,
64  /*! Choose this if no perfect match like above can be expected, for example when
65  an IR component with constant parameters is calibrated to a basket of swaptions.
66  The calibration routine will consequently not throw an exception when the match
67  is imperfect.
68  */
69  BestFit,
70  /*! No calibration
71  */
72  None
73 };

◆ MarketContext

enum MarketContext
strong

Market configuration contexts. Note that there is only one pricing context. If several are needed (for different trade types, different collateral currencies etc.), several engine factories should be set up for each such portfolio subset.

◆ flip()

std::string flip ( const std::string &  id,
const std::string &  sep = "-" 
)

Flips the first two tokens in a string like CCY1-CCY2-TEXT, only used in the context of CrossCcyBasisSwap convention IDs

Definition at line 2426 of file conventions.cpp.

2426  {
2427  boost::tokenizer<boost::escaped_list_separator<char>> tokenSplit(id, boost::escaped_list_separator<char>("\\", sep, "\""));
2428  std::vector<std::string> tokens(tokenSplit.begin(), tokenSplit.end());
2429  if (tokens.size() >= 2 && tokens[0].size() == 3 && tokens[1].size() == 3) {
2430  std::string id2 = tokens[1] + sep + tokens[0];
2431  for (Size i = 2; i < tokens.size(); ++i)
2432  id2 += sep + tokens[i];
2433  return id2; // flipped id
2434  }
2435  else return id; // original id
2436 }
Here is the caller graph for this function:

◆ indexNameLessThan()

bool indexNameLessThan ( const std::string &  index1,
const std::string &  index2 
)

Definition at line 224 of file correlationcurveconfig.cpp.

224  {
225  vector<string> tokens1;
226  boost::split(tokens1, index1, boost::is_any_of("-"));
227  vector<string> tokens2;
228  boost::split(tokens2, index2, boost::is_any_of("-"));
229 
230  QL_REQUIRE(tokens1.size() >= 2, "at least two tokens expected in " << index1);
231  QL_REQUIRE(tokens2.size() >= 2, "at least two tokens expected in " << index2);
232 
233  Size s1, s2;
234 
235  if (tokens1[1] == "CMS")
236  s1 = 4;
237  else if (tokens1[0] == "FX")
238  s1 = 2;
239  else if (tokens1[0] == "EQ")
240  s1 = 1;
241  else if (tokens1[0] == "COMM")
242  s1 = 0;
243  else
244  s1 = 3; // assume Ibor
245 
246  if (tokens2[1] == "CMS")
247  s2 = 4;
248  else if (tokens2[0] == "FX")
249  s2 = 2;
250  else if (tokens2[0] == "EQ")
251  s2 = 1;
252  else if (tokens2[0] == "COMM")
253  s2 = 0;
254  else
255  s2 = 3; // assume Ibor
256 
257  if (s1 < s2)
258  return true;
259  else if (s2 < s1)
260  return false;
261 
262  // both EQ or both COM
263  if (s1 == 0 || s1 == 1)
264  return tokens1[1] < tokens2[1];
265 
266  QL_REQUIRE(tokens1.size() >= 3, "at least three tokens expected in " << index1);
267  QL_REQUIRE(tokens2.size() >= 3, "at least three tokens expected in " << index2);
268 
269  // both CMS or both Ibor, tenor is the last token (3rd or even 4th for customised CMS indices)
270  if (s1 == 3 || s1 == 4)
271  return parsePeriod(tokens1.back()) < parsePeriod(tokens2.back());
272 
273  QL_REQUIRE(tokens1.size() >= 4, "at least four tokens expected in " << index1);
274  QL_REQUIRE(tokens2.size() >= 4, "at least four tokens expected in " << index2);
275 
276  // both FX, compare CCY1 then CCY2 alphabetical
277  if (s1 == 2) {
278  return (tokens1[2] + "-" + tokens1[3]) < (tokens2[2] + "-" + tokens2[3]);
279  }
280 
281  QL_FAIL("indexNameLessThan(): internal error");
282 }
Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ parseYieldCurveSegment()

YieldCurveSegment::Type ore::data::parseYieldCurveSegment ( const string &  s)

Definition at line 37 of file yieldcurveconfig.cpp.

37  {
38  if (iequals(s, "Zero"))
39  return YieldCurveSegment::Type::Zero;
40  else if (iequals(s, "Zero Spread"))
41  return YieldCurveSegment::Type::ZeroSpread;
42  else if (iequals(s, "Discount"))
43  return YieldCurveSegment::Type::Discount;
44  else if (iequals(s, "Deposit"))
45  return YieldCurveSegment::Type::Deposit;
46  else if (iequals(s, "FRA"))
47  return YieldCurveSegment::Type::FRA;
48  else if (iequals(s, "Future"))
49  return YieldCurveSegment::Type::Future;
50  else if (iequals(s, "OIS"))
51  return YieldCurveSegment::Type::OIS;
52  else if (iequals(s, "Swap"))
53  return YieldCurveSegment::Type::Swap;
54  else if (iequals(s, "Average OIS"))
55  return YieldCurveSegment::Type::AverageOIS;
56  else if (iequals(s, "Tenor Basis Swap"))
57  return YieldCurveSegment::Type::TenorBasis;
58  else if (iequals(s, "Tenor Basis Two Swaps"))
59  return YieldCurveSegment::Type::TenorBasisTwo;
60  else if (iequals(s, "BMA Basis Swap"))
61  return YieldCurveSegment::Type::BMABasis;
62  else if (iequals(s, "FX Forward"))
63  return YieldCurveSegment::Type::FXForward;
64  else if (iequals(s, "Cross Currency Basis Swap"))
65  return YieldCurveSegment::Type::CrossCcyBasis;
66  else if (iequals(s, "Cross Currency Fix Float Swap"))
67  return YieldCurveSegment::Type::CrossCcyFixFloat;
68  else if (iequals(s, "Discount Ratio"))
69  return YieldCurveSegment::Type::DiscountRatio;
70  else if (iequals(s, "FittedBond"))
71  return YieldCurveSegment::Type::FittedBond;
72  else if (iequals(s, "Yield Plus Default"))
73  return YieldCurveSegment::Type::YieldPlusDefault;
74  else if (iequals(s, "Weighted Average"))
75  return YieldCurveSegment::Type::WeightedAverage;
76  else if (iequals(s, "Ibor Fallback"))
77  return YieldCurveSegment::Type::IborFallback;
78  QL_FAIL("Yield curve segment type " << s << " not recognized");
79 }

◆ operator<() [3/10]

bool operator< ( const CurveSpec &  lhs,
const CurveSpec &  rhs 
)

Relational operators for CurveSpecs.

Definition at line 27 of file curvespec.cpp.

27  {
28  if (lhs == rhs) {
29  /* If CurveSpecs are equal (i.e. have same name), return false. */
30  return false;
31  } else if (lhs.baseType() != rhs.baseType()) {
32  /* If types are not the same, use the enum value for ordering along type.
33  * The enum order in the header file is deliberate, it ensures that FX comes before FXVol
34  * this property is used in data::order() (see curveloader.hpp)
35  */
36  return lhs.baseType() < rhs.baseType();
37  } else {
38  /* If types are the same and CurveSpecs are different, use default < for string */
39  return lhs.name() < rhs.name();
40  }
41 }

110  {
111 
112  QL_REQUIRE(strExpiry.size() > 1, "Expiry string must have at least 2 characters");
113 
114  if (strExpiry.at(0) == 'c') {
115  auto expiry = boost::make_shared<FutureContinuationExpiry>();
116  expiry->fromString(strExpiry);
117  return expiry;
118  } else {

124  return boost::make_shared<ExpiryDate>(date);

127  }
128  }

◆ applyFixings()

void applyFixings ( const set< Fixing > &  fixings)

Utility to write a vector of fixings in the QuantLib index manager's fixing history.

Definition at line 41 of file fixings.cpp.

41  {
42 
43  QuantExt::SavedObservableSettings savedObservableSettings;
44  ObservableSettings::instance().disableUpdates(true);
45 
46  Size count = 0;
47  cpu_timer timer;
48  boost::shared_ptr<Index> index;
49  std::string lastIndexName;
50  for (auto& f : fixings) {
51  if(f.name.empty()) {
52  WLOG("Skipping fixing with empty name, value " << f.fixing << ", date " << f.date);
53  }
54  try {
55  if (lastIndexName != f.name) {
56  index = parseIndex(f.name);
57  lastIndexName = f.name;
58  }
59  index->addFixing(f.date, f.fixing, true);
60  TLOG("Added fixing for " << f.name << " (" << io::iso_date(f.date) << ") value:" << f.fixing);
61  ++count;
62  } catch (const std::exception& e) {
63  WLOG("Error during adding fixing for " << f.name << ": " << e.what());
64  }
65  }
66  timer.stop();
67  LOG("Added " << count << " of " << fixings.size() << " fixings in " << timer.format(default_places, "%w")
68  << " seconds");
69 }

◆ applyDividends()

void applyDividends ( const set< Fixing > &  dividends)

Utility to write a vector of fixings in the QuantLib index manager's fixing history.

Definition at line 71 of file fixings.cpp.

71  {
72  Size count = 0;
73  map<string, boost::shared_ptr<EquityIndex>> cache;
74  cpu_timer timer;
75  boost::shared_ptr<EquityIndex> index;
76  std::string lastIndexName;
77  for (auto& f : dividends) {
78  try {
79  if (lastIndexName != f.name) {
80  index = boost::make_shared<EquityIndex>(f.name, NullCalendar(), Currency());
81  lastIndexName = f.name;
82  }
83  index->addDividend(f.date, f.fixing, true);
84  TLOG("Added dividend for " << f.name << " (" << io::iso_date(f.date) << ") value:" << f.fixing);
85  count++;
86  } catch (const std::exception& e) {
87  WLOG("Error during adding dividend for " << f.name << ": " << e.what());
88  }
89  }
90  timer.stop();
91  DLOG("Added " << count << " of " << dividends.size() << " dividends in " << timer.format(default_places, "%w")

508  {
509  // straight pair
510  auto tmpCorr = correlationCurves.find("Correlation/" + index1 + "&" + index2);
511  if (tmpCorr != correlationCurves.end()) {
512  return Handle<QuantExt::CorrelationTermStructure>(tmpCorr->second->corrTermStructure());
513  }
514  // inverse pair
515  tmpCorr = correlationCurves.find("Correlation/" + index2 + "&" + index1);

517  return Handle<QuantExt::CorrelationTermStructure>(tmpCorr->second->corrTermStructure());
518  }

523  Handle<QuantExt::CorrelationTermStructure>(tmpCorr->second->corrTermStructure());

538  Handle<QuantExt::CorrelationTermStructure>(tmpCorr->second->corrTermStructure());
539  return Handle<QuantExt::CorrelationTermStructure>(
540  boost::make_shared<QuantExt::NegativeCorrelationTermStructure>(h));

543  if (tmpCorr != correlationCurves.end()) {
544  Handle<QuantExt::CorrelationTermStructure> h =
545  Handle<QuantExt::CorrelationTermStructure>(tmpCorr->second->corrTermStructure());
546  return Handle<QuantExt::CorrelationTermStructure>(
547  boost::make_shared<QuantExt::NegativeCorrelationTermStructure>(h));
548  }
549  // both fx indices inverted
550  tmpCorr = correlationCurves.find("Correlation/" + inverseFxIndex(index1) + "&" + inverseFxIndex(index2));
551  if (tmpCorr != correlationCurves.end()) {
552  return Handle<QuantExt::CorrelationTermStructure>(tmpCorr->second->corrTermStructure());
553  }

556  return Handle<QuantExt::CorrelationTermStructure>(tmpCorr->second->corrTermStructure());
557  }
558

560 }

◆ getInflationSwapStart() [1/2]

QuantLib::Date ore::data::getInflationSwapStart ( const Date &  asof,
const InflationSwapConvention &  convention 
)

Given an asof and inflation swap convention, determine the start date of an inflation swap.

In general, this just returns the asof. If the convention has a publication roll and a publication schedule, the swap start date will be generated according to this schedule.

Here is the caller graph for this function:

◆ load()

void ore::data::load ( InMemoryLoader &  loader,
const vector< string > &  data,
bool  isMarket,
bool  implyTodaysFixings 
)

Definition at line 130 of file inmemoryloader.cpp.

130  {
131  LOG("MemoryLoader started");
132 
133  Date today = QuantLib::Settings::instance().evaluationDate();
134 
135  for (Size i = 0; i < data.size(); ++i) {
136  string line = data[i];
137  // skip blank and comment lines
138  if (line.size() > 0 && line[0] != '#') {
139  vector<string> tokens;
140  boost::trim(line);
141  boost::split(tokens, line, boost::is_any_of(",;\t "), boost::token_compress_on);
142 
143  // TODO: should we try, catch and log any invalid lines?
144  QL_REQUIRE(tokens.size() == 3, "Invalid MemoryLoader line, 3 tokens expected " << line);
145  Date date = parseDate(tokens[0]);
146  const string& key = tokens[1];
147  Real value = parseReal(tokens[2]);
148 
149  if (isMarket) {
150  // process market
151  // build market datum and add to map
152  try {
153  loader.add(date, key, value);
154  TLOG("Added MarketDatum " << key);
155  } catch (std::exception& e) {
156  WLOG("Failed to parse MarketDatum " << key << ": " << e.what());
157  }
158  } else {
159  // process fixings
160  if (date < today || (date == today && !implyTodaysFixings))
161  loader.addFixing(date, key, value);
162  }
163  }
164  }
165  LOG("MemoryLoader completed");
166 }
Here is the call graph for this function:
Here is the caller graph for this function:

)

Utility function for loading market quotes and fixings from an in memory csv buffer.

Parameters
loaderThe loader that will be populated
marketDataQuantLib::Date Key Value in a single std::string, separated by blanks, tabs, colons or commas

implyTodaysFixingsEnable/disable implying today's fixings

◆ parseBaseStrike()

boost::shared_ptr< BaseStrike > parseBaseStrike ( const string &  strStrike)

Parse a Strike from its string representation, strStrike.

Definition at line 262 of file strike.cpp.

262  {
263 
264  boost::shared_ptr<BaseStrike> strike;
265 
266  // Expect strStrike to either:
267  // 1. have a single token which means that we have an absolute strike, or
268  // 2. have multiple tokens beginning with one of DEL, ATM or MNY
269  vector<string> tokens;
270  boost::split(tokens, strStrike, boost::is_any_of("/"));
271 
272  if (tokens.size() == 1) {
273  strike = boost::make_shared<AbsoluteStrike>();
274  } else if (tokens[0] == "DEL") {
275  strike = boost::make_shared<DeltaStrike>();
276  } else if (tokens[0] == "ATM") {
277  strike = boost::make_shared<AtmStrike>();
278  } else if (tokens[0] == "MNY") {
279  strike = boost::make_shared<MoneynessStrike>();
280  } else {
281  QL_FAIL("Could not parse strike string '" << strStrike << "'.");
282  }
283 
284  strike->fromString(strStrike);
285 
286  return strike;
287 }
Here is the caller graph for this function:

◆ operator<<() [19/49]

std::ostream & operator<< ( std::ostream &  o,

◆ buildYieldCurve()

boost::shared_ptr< YieldTermStructure > buildYieldCurve ( const vector< Date > &  dates,
const vector< QuantLib::Real > &  rates,
const DayCounter &  dayCounter,
YieldCurve::InterpolationMethod  interpolationMethod 
)

Templated function to build a YieldTermStructure and apply interpolation methods to it.

Definition at line 99 of file yieldcurve.cpp.

101  {
102 
103  boost::shared_ptr<YieldTermStructure> yieldts;
104  switch (interpolationMethod) {
105  case YieldCurve::InterpolationMethod::Linear:
106  yieldts.reset(new CurveType<QuantLib::Linear>(dates, rates, dayCounter, QuantLib::Linear()));
107  break;
108  case YieldCurve::InterpolationMethod::LogLinear:
109  yieldts.reset(new CurveType<QuantLib::LogLinear>(dates, rates, dayCounter, QuantLib::LogLinear()));
110  break;
111  case YieldCurve::InterpolationMethod::NaturalCubic:
112  yieldts.reset(new CurveType<QuantLib::Cubic>(dates, rates, dayCounter,
113  QuantLib::Cubic(CubicInterpolation::Kruger, true)));
114  break;
115  case YieldCurve::InterpolationMethod::FinancialCubic:
116  yieldts.reset(new CurveType<QuantLib::Cubic>(dates, rates, dayCounter,
117  QuantLib::Cubic(CubicInterpolation::Kruger, true,
118  CubicInterpolation::SecondDerivative, 0.0,
119  CubicInterpolation::FirstDerivative)));
120  break;
121  case YieldCurve::InterpolationMethod::ConvexMonotone:
122  yieldts.reset(new CurveType<QuantLib::ConvexMonotone>(dates, rates, dayCounter));
123  break;
124  case YieldCurve::InterpolationMethod::Quadratic:
125  yieldts.reset(new CurveType<QuantExt::Quadratic>(dates, rates, dayCounter, QuantExt::Quadratic(1, 0, 1, 0, 1)));
126  break;
127  case YieldCurve::InterpolationMethod::LogQuadratic:
128  yieldts.reset(
129  new CurveType<QuantExt::LogQuadratic>(dates, rates, dayCounter, QuantExt::LogQuadratic(1, 0, -1, 0, 1)));
130  break;
131  case YieldCurve::InterpolationMethod::Hermite:
132  yieldts.reset(new CurveType<QuantLib::Cubic>(dates, rates, dayCounter, Cubic(CubicInterpolation::Parabolic)));
133  break;
134  case YieldCurve::InterpolationMethod::CubicSpline:
135  yieldts.reset(new CurveType<QuantLib::Cubic>(dates, rates, dayCounter,
136  Cubic(CubicInterpolation::Spline, false,
137  CubicInterpolation::SecondDerivative, 0.0,
138  CubicInterpolation::SecondDerivative, 0.0)));
139  break;
140  default:
141  QL_FAIL("Interpolation method not recognised.");
142  }
143  return yieldts;
144 }

◆ parseYieldCurveInterpolationMethod()

YieldCurve::InterpolationMethod parseYieldCurveInterpolationMethod ( const string &  s)

Helper function for parsing interpolation method.

Definition at line 166 of file yieldcurve.cpp.

166  {
167  if (s == "Linear")
168  return YieldCurve::InterpolationMethod::Linear;
169  else if (s == "LogLinear")
170  return YieldCurve::InterpolationMethod::LogLinear;
171  else if (s == "NaturalCubic")
172  return YieldCurve::InterpolationMethod::NaturalCubic;
173  else if (s == "FinancialCubic")
174  return YieldCurve::InterpolationMethod::FinancialCubic;
175  else if (s == "ConvexMonotone")
176  return YieldCurve::InterpolationMethod::ConvexMonotone;
177  else if (s == "ExponentialSplines")
178  return YieldCurve::InterpolationMethod::ExponentialSplines;
179  else if (s == "Quadratic")
180  return YieldCurve::InterpolationMethod::Quadratic;
181  else if (s == "LogQuadratic")
182  return YieldCurve::InterpolationMethod::LogQuadratic;
183  else if (s == "Hermite")
184  return YieldCurve::InterpolationMethod::Hermite;
185  else if (s == "CubicSpline")
186  return YieldCurve::InterpolationMethod::CubicSpline;
187  else if (s == "NelsonSiegel")
188  return YieldCurve::InterpolationMethod::NelsonSiegel;
189  else if (s == "Svensson")
190  return YieldCurve::InterpolationMethod::Svensson;
191  else
192  QL_FAIL("Yield curve interpolation method " << s << " not recognized");
193 };

◆ getCalibrationDetails() [1/6]

std::string getCalibrationDetails ( LgmCalibrationInfo &  info,
const std::vector< boost::shared_ptr< BlackCalibrationHelper >> &  basket,
const boost::shared_ptr< IrLgm1fParametrization > &  parametrization 
)

Definition at line 124 of file utilities.cpp.

126  {
127  std::ostringstream log;
128  log << std::right << std::setw(3) << "#" << std::setw(14) << "time" << std::setw(14) << "modelVol" << std::setw(14)
129  << "marketVol" << std::setw(14) << "(diff)" << std::setw(14) << "modelValue" << std::setw(14) << "marketValue"
130  << std::setw(14) << "(diff)" << std::setw(14) << "irlgm1fAlpha" << std::setw(14) << "irlgm1fKappa"
131  << std::setw(16) << "irlgm1fHwSigma\n";
132  Real t = 0.0, modelAlpha = 0.0, modelKappa = 0.0, modelHwSigma = 0.0;
133  info.lgmCalibrationData.clear();
134  for (Size j = 0; j < basket.size(); j++) {
135  Real modelValue = basket[j]->modelValue();
136  Real marketValue = basket[j]->marketValue();
137  Real valueDiff = modelValue - marketValue;
138  Volatility modelVol = 0, marketVol = 0, volDiff = 0;
139  boost::shared_ptr<SwaptionHelper> swaption = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<SwaptionHelper>(basket[j]);
140  if (swaption != nullptr && parametrization != nullptr) {
141  // report alpha, kappa at t_expiry^-
142  t = parametrization->termStructure()->timeFromReference(swaption->swaption()->exercise()->date(0));
143  modelAlpha = parametrization->alpha(t - 1E-4);
144  modelKappa = parametrization->kappa(t - 1E-4);
145  modelHwSigma = parametrization->hullWhiteSigma(t - 1E-4);
146  }
147  // TODO handle other calibration helpers, too (capfloor)
148  marketVol = basket[j]->volatility()->value();
149  modelVol = impliedVolatility(basket[j]);
150  volDiff = modelVol - marketVol;
151  log << std::setw(3) << j << std::setprecision(6) << std::setw(14) << t << std::setw(14) << modelVol
152  << std::setw(14) << marketVol << std::setw(14) << volDiff << std::setw(14) << modelValue << std::setw(14)
153  << marketValue << std::setw(14) << valueDiff << std::setw(14) << modelAlpha << std::setw(14) << modelKappa
154  << std::setw(16) << modelHwSigma << "\n";
155  info.lgmCalibrationData.push_back(
156  LgmCalibrationData{t, modelVol, marketVol, modelValue, marketValue, modelAlpha, modelKappa, modelHwSigma});
157  }
158  if (parametrization != nullptr) {
159  // report alpha, kappa at t_expiry^+ for last expiry
160  modelAlpha = parametrization->alpha(t + 1E-4);
161  modelKappa = parametrization->kappa(t + 1E-4);
162  modelHwSigma = parametrization->hullWhiteSigma(t + 1E-4);
163  }
164  log << "t >= " << t << ": irlgm1fAlpha = " << modelAlpha << " irlgm1fKappa = " << modelKappa
165  << " irlgm1fHwSigma = " << modelHwSigma << "\n";
166  return log.str();
167 }

◆ getCalibrationDetails() [4/6]

std::string getCalibrationDetails ( const std::vector< boost::shared_ptr< BlackCalibrationHelper >> &  basket,
const boost::shared_ptr< InfDkParametrization > &  parametrization,
bool  indexIsInterpolated 
)

Definition at line 235 of file utilities.cpp.

237  {
238  std::ostringstream log;
239  log << std::right << std::setw(3) << "#" << std::setw(14) << "time" << std::setw(14) << "modelValue"
240  << std::setw(14) << "marketValue" << std::setw(14) << "(diff)" << std::setw(14) << "infdkAlpha" << std::setw(14)
241  << "infdkH\n";
242  Real t = 0.0, modelAlpha = 0.0, modelH = 0.0;
243  for (Size j = 0; j < basket.size(); j++) {
244  Real modelValue = basket[j]->modelValue();
245  Real marketValue = basket[j]->marketValue();
246  Real valueDiff = (modelValue - marketValue);
247  boost::shared_ptr<CpiCapFloorHelper> instr = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<CpiCapFloorHelper>(basket[j]);
248  if (instr != nullptr && parametrization != nullptr) {
249  // report alpha, H at t_expiry^-
250  t = inflationYearFraction(
251  parametrization->termStructure()->frequency(), indexIsInterpolated,
252  parametrization->termStructure()->dayCounter(), parametrization->termStructure()->baseDate(),
253  instr->instrument()->payDate() - parametrization->termStructure()->observationLag());
254  modelAlpha = parametrization->alpha(t - 1.0 / 250.0);
255  modelH = parametrization->H(t - 1.0 / 250.0);
256  }
257  // TODO handle other calibration helpers, too (capfloor)
258  log << std::setw(3) << j << std::setprecision(6) << std::setw(14) << t << std::setw(14) << modelValue
259  << std::setw(14) << marketValue << std::setw(14) << valueDiff << std::setw(14) << modelAlpha
260  << std::setw(14) << modelH << "\n";
261  }
262  if (parametrization != nullptr) {
263  // report alpha, kappa at t_expiry^+ for last expiry
264  modelAlpha = parametrization->alpha(t + 1.0 / 250.0);
265  modelH = parametrization->H(t + 1.0 / 2500.0);
266  }
267  log << "t >= " << t << ": infDkAlpha = " << modelAlpha << " infDkH = " << modelH << "\n";
268  return log.str();
269 }

281  // Header rows
282  log << "Real rate calibration:\n";
283  log << right << setw(3) << "#" << setw(5) << "](-" << setw(12) << "inst_date" << setw(12) << "time" << setw(14)
284  << "modelValue" << setw(14) << "marketValue" << setw(14) << "(diff)" << setw(14) << "infJyAlpha" << setw(14)
285  << "infJyH\n";
286 
287  // Parameter values for corresponding to maturity of each instrument
288  Array times = calibrateRealRateVol ? p->realRate()->parameterTimes(0) : p->realRate()->parameterTimes(1);
289  auto helperValues = jyHelperValues(rrBasket, times);
290  Size ctr = 0;
291  Time t = 0.0;
292  for (const auto& kv : helperValues) {
293  auto hv = kv.second;
294  t = hv.maturity - epsTime;
295  string bound = "<=";
296  if (helperValues.size() == 1) {
297  bound = " -";
298  } else if (ctr == helperValues.size() - 1) {
299  t += 2 * epsTime;
300  bound = " >";
301  }
302  auto alpha = p->realRate()->alpha(t);
303  auto h = p->realRate()->H(t);
304  log << setw(3) << ctr++ << setw(5) << bound << setw(6) << io::iso_date(kv.first) << setprecision(6)
305  << setw(12) << hv.maturity << setw(14) << hv.modelValue << setw(14) << hv.marketValue << setw(14)
306  << hv.error << setw(14) << alpha << setw(14) << h << "\n";
307  }
308  }
309 
310  // Inflation index basket: if it has instruments, the inflation index was calibrated.
311  if (!idxBasket.empty()) {
312 
313  // Header rows
314  log << "Inflation index calibration:\n";
315  log << right << setw(3) << "#" << setw(5) << "](-" << setw(12) << "inst_date" << setw(12) << "time" << setw(14)
316  << "modelValue" << setw(14) << "marketValue" << setw(14) << "(diff)" << setw(14) << "infJySigma\n";
317 
318  // Parameter values for corresponding to maturity of each instrument
319  Array times = p->index()->parameterTimes(0);
320  auto helperValues = jyHelperValues(idxBasket, times);
321  Size ctr = 0;
322  Time t = 0.0;
323  for (const auto& kv : helperValues) {
324  auto hv = kv.second;
325  t = hv.maturity - epsTime;
326  string bound = "<=";
327  if (helperValues.size() == 1) {
328  bound = " -";
329  } else if (ctr == helperValues.size() - 1) {
330  t += 2 * epsTime;
331  bound = " >";
332  }
333  auto sigma = p->index()->sigma(t);
334  log << setw(3) << ctr++ << setw(5) << bound << setw(6) << io::iso_date(kv.first) << setprecision(6)
335  << setw(12) << hv.maturity << setw(14) << hv.modelValue << setw(14) << hv.marketValue << setw(14)
336  << hv.error << setw(14) << sigma << "\n";
337  }
338  }
339 
340  return log.str();
341 }
Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ getCalibrationDetails() [6/6]

std::string getCalibrationDetails ( const boost::shared_ptr< IrLgm1fParametrization > &  parametrization)

343  {
344  std::ostringstream log;
345 
346  log << right << setw(3) << "#" << setw(14) << "time" << setw(14) << "irlgm1fAlpha" << setw(14)
347  << "irlgm1fHwSigma\n";
348  Real t = 0.0;
349  Size j = 0;
350  for (; j < parametrization->parameterTimes(0).size(); ++j) {
351  t = parametrization->parameterTimes(0)[j];
352  Real alpha = parametrization->alpha(t - 1E-4);
353  Real sigma = parametrization->hullWhiteSigma(t - 1E-4);
354  log << setw(3) << j << setprecision(6) << setw(14) << t << setw(14) << alpha << setw(14) << sigma << "\n";
355  }
356  log << setw(3) << j << setprecision(6) << setw(14) << (std::to_string(t) + "+") << setw(14)
357  << parametrization->alpha(t + 1E-4) << setw(14) << parametrization->hullWhiteSigma(t + 1E-4) << "\n";
358

361  j = 0;
362  for (; j < parametrization->parameterTimes(1).size(); ++j) {

365  Real H = parametrization->H(t - 1E-4);

367  }
368  log << setw(3) << j << setprecision(6) << setw(14) << (std::to_string(t) + "+") << setw(14)
369  << parametrization->kappa(t + 1E-4) << setw(14) << parametrization->H(t + 1E-4) << "\n";

)

Return a cpi cap/floor strike value, the input strike can be of type absolute or atm forward.

399  {
400  if (auto abs = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<AbsoluteStrike>(strike)) {
401  return abs->strike();
402  } else if (auto atm = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<AtmStrike>(strike)) {
403  QL_REQUIRE(atm->atmType() == DeltaVolQuote::AtmFwd,
404  "only atm forward allowed as atm strike for cpi cap floors");

409  }

◆ getCalibrationError()

Real ore::data::getCalibrationError ( const std::vector< boost::shared_ptr< Helper >> &  basket)

Definition at line 46 of file utilities.hpp.

46  {
47  Real rmse = 0.0;
48  for (auto const& h : basket) {
49  Real tmp = h->calibrationError();
50  rmse += tmp * tmp;
51  }
52  return std::sqrt(rmse / static_cast<Real>(basket.size()));
53 }

Populate bond data from name and ReferenceDataManager.

The following elements are references and updated, if empty: issuerId settlementDays calendar issueDate creditCurveId creditGroup referenceCurveId incomeCurveId volatilityCurveId coupons

19  {
20  DLOG("populating data bond from reference data");
21  QL_REQUIRE(bondRefData, "populateFromBondReferenceData(): empty bond reference datum given");
22  if (issuerId.empty()) {
23  issuerId = bondRefData->bondData().issuerId;
24  TLOG("overwrite issuerId with '" << issuerId << "'");
25  }
26  if (settlementDays.empty()) {
27  settlementDays = bondRefData->bondData().settlementDays;
28  TLOG("overwrite settlementDays with '" << settlementDays << "'");
29  }
30  if (calendar.empty()) {
31  calendar = bondRefData->bondData().calendar;
32  TLOG("overwrite calendar with '" << calendar << "'");
33  }
34  if (issueDate.empty()) {
35  issueDate = bondRefData->bondData().issueDate;
36  TLOG("overwrite issueDate with '" << issueDate << "'");
37  }
38  if (priceQuoteMethod.empty()) {
39  priceQuoteMethod = bondRefData->bondData().priceQuoteMethod;
40  TLOG("overwrite priceQuoteMethod with '" << priceQuoteMethod << "'");
41  }
42  if (priceQuoteBaseValue.empty()) {
43  priceQuoteBaseValue = bondRefData->bondData().priceQuoteBaseValue;
44  TLOG("overwrite priceQuoteBaseValue with '" << priceQuoteBaseValue << "'");
45  }
46  if (creditCurveId.empty()) {
47  creditCurveId = bondRefData->bondData().creditCurveId;
48  TLOG("overwrite creditCurveId with '" << creditCurveId << "'");
49  }
50  if (creditGroup.empty()) {
51  creditGroup = bondRefData->bondData().creditGroup;
52  TLOG("overwrite creditGroup with '" << creditGroup << "'");
53  }
54  if (referenceCurveId.empty()) {
55  referenceCurveId = bondRefData->bondData().referenceCurveId;
56  TLOG("overwrite referenceCurveId with '" << referenceCurveId << "'");
57  }
58  if (incomeCurveId.empty()) {
59  incomeCurveId = bondRefData->bondData().incomeCurveId;
60  TLOG("overwrite incomeCurveId with '" << incomeCurveId << "'");
61  }
62  if (volatilityCurveId.empty()) {
63  volatilityCurveId = bondRefData->bondData().volatilityCurveId;
64  TLOG("overwrite volatilityCurveId with '" << volatilityCurveId << "'");
65  }
66  if (coupons.empty()) {
67  coupons = bondRefData->bondData().legData;
68  TLOG("overwrite coupons with " << coupons.size() << " LegData nodes");
69  }
70  if (!startDate.empty()) {
71  if (coupons.size() == 1 && coupons.front().schedule().rules().size() == 1 && coupons.front().schedule().dates().size() == 0) {
72  string oldStart = coupons.front().schedule().rules().front().startDate();
73  coupons.front().schedule().modifyRules().front().modifyStartDate() = startDate;
74  string newStart = coupons.front().schedule().rules().front().startDate();
75  DLOG("Modified start date " << oldStart << " -> " << newStart);
76  }
77  else {
78  ALOG(StructuredTradeErrorMessage(bondRefData->bondData().issuerId, "Bond-linked", "update reference data",
79  "modifified start date cannot be applied to multiple legs/schedules"));
80  }
81  }
82  if (!endDate.empty()) {
83  if (coupons.size() == 1 && coupons.front().schedule().rules().size() == 1 && coupons.front().schedule().dates().size() == 0) {
84  string oldEnd = coupons.front().schedule().rules().front().endDate();
85  coupons.front().schedule().modifyRules().front().modifyEndDate() = endDate;
86  string newEnd = coupons.front().schedule().rules().front().endDate();
87  DLOG("Modified end date " << oldEnd << " -> " << newEnd);
88  }
89  else {
90  ALOG(StructuredTradeErrorMessage(bondRefData->bondData().issuerId, "Bond-linked", "update reference data",
91  "modifified end date cannot be applied to multiple legs/schedules"));
92  }
93  }
94 
95  DLOG("populating bond data from reference data done.");
96 }

◆ getOpenEndDateReplacement()

Date getOpenEndDateReplacement ( const std::string &  replacementPeriodStr,
const Calendar &  calendar 
)

Definition at line 98 of file bondutils.cpp.

98  {
99  if (replacementPeriodStr.empty())
100  return QuantLib::Null<QuantLib::Date>();
101  Date today = Settings::instance().evaluationDate();
102  Date result = Date::maxDate() - 365;
103  try {
104  // might throw because we are beyond the last allowed date
105  result = (calendar.empty() ? NullCalendar() : calendar).advance(today, parsePeriod(replacementPeriodStr));
106  } catch (...) {
107  }
108  DLOG("Compute open end date replacement as "
109  << QuantLib::io::iso_date(result) << " (today = " << QuantLib::io::iso_date(today)
110  << ", OpenEndDateReplacement from pricing engine config = " << replacementPeriodStr << ")");
111  return result;
112 }

◆ operator==() [5/8]

bool ore::data::operator== ( const CDSEngineKey &  lhs,
const CDSEngineKey &  rhs 
)

Definition at line 71 of file creditdefaultswap.hpp.

71  {
72 
73  // Check the credit curve IDs first
74  if (lhs.creditCurveId() != rhs.creditCurveId())
75  return false;
76 
77  // Check the currencies
78  if (lhs.currency() != rhs.currency())
79  return false;
80 
81  // Now check recovery rates.
82  if (lhs.recoveryRate() == QuantLib::Null<QuantLib::Real>() &&
83  rhs.recoveryRate() == QuantLib::Null<QuantLib::Real>()) {
84  // Most usual case is both are Null<Real> and using the recovery rate from the market.
85  return true;
86  } else if ((lhs.recoveryRate() != QuantLib::Null<QuantLib::Real>() &&
87  rhs.recoveryRate() == QuantLib::Null<QuantLib::Real>()) ||
88  (lhs.recoveryRate() == QuantLib::Null<QuantLib::Real>() &&
89  rhs.recoveryRate() != QuantLib::Null<QuantLib::Real>())) {
90  return false;
91  } else {
92  return QuantLib::close(lhs.recoveryRate(), rhs.recoveryRate());
93  }
94 }
Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ operator<() [7/10]

bool ore::data::operator< ( const CDSEngineKey &  lhs,
const CDSEngineKey &  rhs 
)

Definition at line 96 of file creditdefaultswap.hpp.

96  {
97 
98  // Check equality first
99  if (lhs == rhs)
100  return false;
101 
102  // Now check credit curve Ids.
103  if (lhs.creditCurveId() != rhs.creditCurveId())
104  return lhs.creditCurveId() < rhs.creditCurveId();
105 
106  // Now check currencies.
107  if (lhs.currency() != rhs.currency())
108  return lhs.currency().name() < rhs.currency().name();
109 
110  // Now use the recovery rates
111  return lhs.recoveryRate() < rhs.recoveryRate();
112 }
Here is the call graph for this function:

194  {
195  switch (creditEventType) {
196  case ore::data::CreditEventType::BANKRUPTCY:
197  case ore::data::CreditEventType::FAILURE_TO_PAY:
198  case ore::data::CreditEventType::REPUDIATION_MORATORIUM:
199  // all of the above include a failure to pay
200  switch (contractDocClause) {
201  case ore::data::CdsDocClause::CR:
202  case ore::data::CdsDocClause::CR14:
203  case ore::data::CdsDocClause::MM:
204  case ore::data::CdsDocClause::MM14:
205  case ore::data::CdsDocClause::MR:
206  case ore::data::CdsDocClause::MR14:
207  case ore::data::CdsDocClause::XR:
208  case ore::data::CdsDocClause::XR14:
209  return true;
210  default:
211  break;
212  }
213  break;
214  case ore::data::CreditEventType::GOVERNMENTAL_INTERVENTION:
215  // typically includes a conversion to shares with a write down
216  case ore::data::CreditEventType::RESTRUCTURING:
217  // it depends on the type of restructure!
218  switch (contractDocClause) {
219  case ore::data::CdsDocClause::CR:
220  case ore::data::CdsDocClause::CR14:
221  case ore::data::CdsDocClause::MM:
222  case ore::data::CdsDocClause::MM14:
223  case ore::data::CdsDocClause::MR:
224  case ore::data::CdsDocClause::MR14:
225  return true;
226  case ore::data::CdsDocClause::XR:
227  case ore::data::CdsDocClause::XR14:
228  return false;
229  default:
230  break;
231  }
232  case ore::data::CreditEventType::OBLIGATION_ACCELERATION:
233  case ore::data::CreditEventType::OBLIGATION_DEFAULT:
234  // not necessarily a default itself, no examples in record.
235  return false;
236  break;
237  default:
238  break;
239  }
240  QL_FAIL("Could not recognize CreditEventType "
241  << static_cast<int>(creditEventType) << " or CdsDocClause " << static_cast<int>(contractDocClause)
242  << " when identifying whether a doc clause is triggrered for a given credit event type.");
243  return false;
244 }

◆ parseCreditEventTiers()

CreditEventTiers parseCreditEventTiers ( const string &  s)

Definition at line 246 of file creditdefaultswapdata.cpp.

246  {
247  if (s == "SNR") {
248  return CreditEventTiers::SNR;
249  } else if (s == "SUB") {
250  return CreditEventTiers::SUB;
251  } else if (s == "SNRLAC") {
252  return CreditEventTiers::SNRLAC;
253  } else if (s == "SNR/SUB") {
254  return CreditEventTiers::SNR_SUB;
255  } else if (s == "SNR/SNRLAC") {
256  return CreditEventTiers::SNR_SNRLAC;
257  } else if (s == "SUB/SNRLAC") {
258  return CreditEventTiers::SUB_SNRLAC;
259  } else if (s == "SNR/SUB/SNRLAC") {
260  return CreditEventTiers::SNR_SUB_SNRLAC;
261  } else {
262  QL_FAIL("Could not parse \"" << s << "\" to a credit event tiers set.");
263  }
264 }

127  {
128  vector<string> products = lhs.products();
129  // this assumes they are both sorted the same
130  if (products != rhs.products())
131  return false;
132  // now loop over the products and check everything
133  for (auto product : products) {
134  if (lhs.model(product) != rhs.model(product) || lhs.modelParameters(product) != rhs.modelParameters(product) ||
135  lhs.engine(product) != rhs.engine(product) ||
136  lhs.engineParameters(product) != rhs.engineParameters(product))
137  return false;
138  }
139  return true;
140 }

◆ amendInflationFixingDates() [1/2]

void ore::data::amendInflationFixingDates ( map< string, set< Date >> &  fixings)

Definition at line 488 of file fixingdates.cpp.

488  {
489  // Loop over indices and amend any that are of type InflationIndex
490  for (auto& kv : fixings) {
491  auto p = isInflationIndex(kv.first);
492  if (p.first) {
493  // We have an inflation index
494  set<Date> newDates;
495  Frequency f = p.second->frequency();
496  for (const Date& d : kv.second) {
497  auto period = inflationPeriod(d, f);
498  if (d == period.first) {
499  // If the fixing date is the start of the inflation period, move it to the end.
500  newDates.insert(period.second);
501  } else {
502  // If the fixing date is not the start of the inflation period, leave it as it is.
503  newDates.insert(d);
504  }
505  }
506  // Update the fixings map that was passed in with the new set of dates
507  kv.second = newDates;
508  }
509  }
510 }

◆ addMarketFixingDates() [1/2]

void ore::data::addMarketFixingDates ( map< string, set< Date >> &  fixings,
const TodaysMarketParameters &  mktParams,
const Period &  iborLookback,
const Period &  oisLookback,
const Period &  bmaLookback,
const Period &  inflationLookback,
const string &  configuration 
)

Definition at line 512 of file fixingdates.cpp.

514  {
515 
516  if (mktParams.hasConfiguration(configuration)) {
517 
518  LOG("Start adding market fixing dates for configuration '" << configuration << "'");
519 
520  boost::shared_ptr<Conventions> conventions = InstrumentConventions::instance().conventions();
521 
522  // If there are ibor indices in the market parameters, add the lookback fixings
523  // IF there are SIFMA / BMA indices, add lookback fixings for the Libor basis index
524  if (mktParams.hasMarketObject(MarketObject::IndexCurve)) {
525 
526  QL_REQUIRE(iborLookback >= 0 * Days, "Ibor lookback period must be non-negative");
527 
528  DLOG("Start adding market fixing dates for interest rate indices.");
529 
530  set<Date> iborDates;
531  set<Date> oisDates;
532  set<Date> bmaDates;
533  WeekendsOnly calendar;
534 
535  // For each of the IR indices in market parameters, insert the dates
536  for (const auto& kv : mktParams.mapping(MarketObject::IndexCurve, configuration)) {
537  if (isOvernightIndex(kv.first)) {
538  if (oisDates.empty()) {
539  TLOG("Generating fixing dates for overnight indices.");
540  oisDates = generateLookbackDates(oisLookback, calendar);
541  }
542  TLOG("Adding extra fixing dates for overnight index " << kv.first);
543  fixings[kv.first].insert(oisDates.begin(), oisDates.end());
544  } else if (isBmaIndex(kv.first)) {
545  if (bmaDates.empty()) {
546  TLOG("Generating fixing dates for bma/sifma indices.");
547  bmaDates = generateLookbackDates(bmaLookback, calendar);
548  }
549  fixings[kv.first].insert(bmaDates.begin(), bmaDates.end());
550  if (iborDates.empty()) {
551  TLOG("Generating fixing dates for ibor indices.");
552  iborDates = generateLookbackDates(iborLookback, calendar);
553  }
554  std::set<string> liborNames;
555  for (auto const& c : conventions->get(Convention::Type::BMABasisSwap)) {
556  auto bma = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<BMABasisSwapConvention>(c);
557  QL_REQUIRE(
558  bma, "internal error, could not cast to BMABasisSwapConvention in addMarketFixingDates()");
559  if (bma->bmaIndexName() == kv.first) {
560  liborNames.insert(bma->liborIndexName());
561  }
562  }
563  for (auto const& l : liborNames) {
564  TLOG("Adding extra fixing dates for libor index " << l << " from bma/sifma index " << kv.first);
565  fixings[l].insert(iborDates.begin(), iborDates.end());
566  }
567  } else {
568  if (iborDates.empty()) {
569  TLOG("Generating fixing dates for ibor indices.");
570  iborDates = generateLookbackDates(iborLookback, calendar);
571  }
572  TLOG("Adding extra fixing dates for ibor index " << kv.first);
573  fixings[kv.first].insert(iborDates.begin(), iborDates.end());
574  }
575  }
576 
577  DLOG("Finished adding market fixing dates for interest rate indices.");
578  }
579 
580  // If there are inflation indices in the market parameters, add the lookback fixings
581  if (mktParams.hasMarketObject(MarketObject::ZeroInflationCurve) ||
582  mktParams.hasMarketObject(MarketObject::YoYInflationCurve)) {
583 
584  QL_REQUIRE(inflationLookback >= 0 * Days, "Inflation lookback period must be non-negative");
585 
586  // Dates that will be used for each of the inflation indices
587  Date today = Settings::instance().evaluationDate();
588  Date lookback = NullCalendar().advance(today, -inflationLookback);
589  lookback = Date(1, lookback.month(), lookback.year());
590  set<Date> dates;
591  do {
592  TLOG("Adding date " << io::iso_date(lookback) << " to fixings for inflation indices");
593  dates.insert(lookback);
594  lookback = NullCalendar().advance(lookback, 1 * Months);
595  } while (lookback <= today);
596 
597  // For each of the inflation indices in market parameters, insert the dates
598  if (mktParams.hasMarketObject(MarketObject::ZeroInflationCurve)) {
599  for (const auto& kv : mktParams.mapping(MarketObject::ZeroInflationCurve, configuration)) {
600  TLOG("Adding extra fixing dates for (zero) inflation index " << kv.first);
601  fixings[kv.first].insert(dates.begin(), dates.end());
602  }
603  }
604 
605  if (mktParams.hasMarketObject(MarketObject::YoYInflationCurve)) {
606  for (const auto& kv : mktParams.mapping(MarketObject::YoYInflationCurve, configuration)) {
607  TLOG("Adding extra fixing dates for (yoy) inflation index " << kv.first);
608  fixings[kv.first].insert(dates.begin(), dates.end());
609  }
610  }
611  }
612 
613  // If there are commodity curves, add "fixings" for this month and two previous months. We add "fixings" for
614  // future contracts with expiry from two months hence to two months prior.
615  if (mktParams.hasMarketObject(MarketObject::CommodityCurve)) {
616 
617  // "Fixing" dates for commodities.
618  Period commodityLookback = 2 * Months;
619  Date today = Settings::instance().evaluationDate();
620  Date lookback = today - commodityLookback;
621  lookback = Date(1, lookback.month(), lookback.year());
622  set<Date> dates;
623  do {
624  TLOG("Adding date " << io::iso_date(lookback) << " to fixings for commodities");
625  dates.insert(lookback++);
626  } while (lookback <= today);
627 
628  // Expiry months and years for which we require future contract fixings. For our purposes here, using the
629  // 1st of the month does not matter. We will just use the date to get the appropriate commodity future
630  // index name below when adding the dates and the "-01" will be removed (for non-daily contracts).
631  Size numberMonths = 2;
632  vector<Date> contractExpiries;
633  Date startContract = today - numberMonths * Months;
634  Date endContract = today + numberMonths * Months;
635  do {
636  Month m = startContract.month();
637  Year y = startContract.year();
638  TLOG("Adding contract month and year (" << m << "," << y << ")");
639  contractExpiries.push_back(Date(1, m, y));
640  startContract += 1 * Months;
641  } while (startContract <= endContract);
642 
643  // For each of the commodity names, create the future contract name with the relevant expiry and insert
644  // the dates. Skip commodity names that do not have future conventions.
645  for (const auto& kv : mktParams.mapping(MarketObject::CommodityCurve, configuration)) {
646 
647  boost::shared_ptr<CommodityFutureConvention> cfc;
648  if (conventions->has(kv.first)) {
649  cfc = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<CommodityFutureConvention>(conventions->get(kv.first));
650  }
651 
652  auto commIdx = parseCommodityIndex(kv.first, false);
653  if (cfc) {
654  if (auto oppIdx = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<OffPeakPowerIndex>(commIdx)) {
655  DLOG("Commodity " << kv.first << " is off-peak power so adding underlying daily contracts.");
656  const auto& opIndex = oppIdx->offPeakIndex();
657  const auto& pIndex = oppIdx->peakIndex();
658  for (const Date& expiry : dates) {
659  auto tmpIdx = oppIdx->clone(expiry);
660  auto opName = opIndex->clone(expiry)->name();
661  TLOG("Adding (date, id) = (" << io::iso_date(expiry) << "," << opName << ")");
662  fixings[opName].insert(expiry);
663  auto pName = pIndex->clone(expiry)->name();
664  TLOG("Adding (date, id) = (" << io::iso_date(expiry) << "," << pName << ")");
665  fixings[pName].insert(expiry);
666  }
667  } else if (cfc->contractFrequency() == Daily) {
668  DLOG("Commodity " << kv.first << " has daily frequency so adding daily contracts.");
669  for (const Date& expiry : dates) {
670  auto indexName = commIdx->clone(expiry)->name();
671  TLOG("Adding (date, id) = (" << io::iso_date(expiry) << "," << indexName << ")");
672  fixings[indexName].insert(expiry);
673  }
674  } else {
675  DLOG("Commodity " << kv.first << " is not daily so adding the monthly contracts.");
676  for (const Date& expiry : contractExpiries) {
677  auto indexName = commIdx->clone(expiry)->name();
678  TLOG("Adding extra fixing dates for commodity future " << indexName);
679  fixings[indexName].insert(dates.begin(), dates.end());
680  }
681  }
682  } else {
683  // Assumption here is that we have a spot index.
684  DLOG("Commodity " << kv.first << " does not have future conventions so adding daily fixings.");
685  auto indexName = commIdx->name();
686  TLOG("Adding extra fixing dates for commodity spot " << indexName);
687  fixings[indexName].insert(dates.begin(), dates.end());
688  }
689  }
690  }
691 
692  LOG("Finished adding market fixing dates for configuration '" << configuration << "'");
693  }
694 }
Here is the call graph for this function:
Here is the caller graph for this function:

◆ amendInflationFixingDates() [2/2]

void ore::data::amendInflationFixingDates ( std::map< std::string, std::set< QuantLib::Date >> &  fixings)

Inflation fixings are generally available on a monthly, or coarser, frequency. When a portfolio is asked for its fixings, and it contains inflation fixings, ORE will by convention put the fixing date as the 1st day of the applicable inflation period. Some market data providers by convention supply the inflation fixings with the date as the last date of the applicable inflation period. This function scans the fixings map, and moves any inflation fixing dates from the 1st day of the inflation period to the last day of the inflation period. The key in the fixings map is the index name and the value is the set of dates for which we require the fixings.

If inflation indices have been set up via ZeroInflationIndex entries in the Conventions, the conventions should be passed here. If not, the default nullptr parameter will be sufficient.

◆ addMarketFixingDates() [2/2]

void ore::data::addMarketFixingDates ( std::map< std::string, std::set< QuantLib::Date >> &  fixings,
const TodaysMarketParameters &  mktParams,
const QuantLib::Period &  iborLookback = 5 *QuantLib::Days,
const QuantLib::Period &  oisLookback = 4 *QuantLib::Months,
const QuantLib::Period &  bmaLookback = 2 *QuantLib::Weeks,
const QuantLib::Period &  inflationLookback = 1 *QuantLib::Years,
const std::string &  configuration = Market::defaultConfiguration 
)

Add index and fixing date pairs to fixings that will be potentially needed to build a TodaysMarket.

These additional index and fixing date pairs are found by scanning the mktParams and:

  • for MarketObject::IndexCurve, take the ibor index name and add the dates for each weekday between settlement date minus iborLookback period or oisLookback period and settlement date. The distinction between Ibor and OIS is made here to cover the fixings necessary for OIS futures. The default value of 4 months covers OIS futures with a contract period of up to 3 months. It would need to be configured differently if OIS futures with a longer contract period are possible.
  • for MarketObject::ZeroInflationCurve, take the inflation index and add the first of each month between settlement date minus inflationLookback period and settlement date
  • for MarketObject::YoYInflationCurve, take the inflation index and add the first of each month between settlement date minus inflationLookback period and settlement date
  • for MarketObject::CommodityCurve, add fixings for future contracts expiring 2 months either side of the settlement date. The fixing dates are added for each weekday going back to the first day of the month that precedes the settlement date by 2 months. The approach here will give rise to some spot commodities being given a future contract name and dates added against them - this should not be a problem as there will be no fixings found for them in any case.

The original fixings map may be empty.

◆ checkBarrier()

bool checkBarrier ( Real  spot,
Barrier::Type  type,
Real  barrier 
)

Definition at line 169 of file fxdigitalbarrieroption.cpp.

169  {
170  switch (type) {
171  case Barrier::DownIn:
172  case Barrier::DownOut:
173  return spot <= barrier;
174  case Barrier::UpIn:
175  case Barrier::UpOut:
176  return spot >= barrier;
177  default:
178  QL_FAIL("unknown barrier type " << type);
179  }
180 }

941  {

964  "Incorrect number of notional values entered, expected at least1, got " << numNotionals);

974  "Compounding method " << zcFixedLegData->compounding() << " not supported");

978  cpnDates.push_back(dates.front());

981

983  double currentRate = i < rates.size() ? rates[i] : rates.back();
984  cpnDates.push_back(dates[i + 1]);
985  Date paymentDate = paymentCalendar.adjust(dates[i + 1], payConvention);
986  leg.push_back(boost::make_shared<ZeroFixedCoupon>(paymentDate, currentNotional, currentRate, dc, cpnDates, comp,
987  zcFixedLegData->subtractNotional()));
988  }
989  return leg;
990 }

◆ makeIborLeg()

Leg makeIborLeg ( const LegData &  data,

)

Definition at line 992 of file legdata.cpp.

994  {
995  boost::shared_ptr<FloatingLegData> floatData = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<FloatingLegData>(data.concreteLegData());
996  QL_REQUIRE(floatData, "Wrong LegType, expected Floating, got " << data.legType());
997 
998  Schedule schedule = makeSchedule(data.schedule(), openEndDateReplacement);
999  Calendar paymentCalendar;
1000  if (data.paymentCalendar().empty())
1001  paymentCalendar = schedule.calendar();
1002  else
1003  paymentCalendar = parseCalendar(data.paymentCalendar());
1004 
1005  DayCounter dc = parseDayCounter(data.dayCounter());
1006  BusinessDayConvention bdc = parseBusinessDayConvention(data.paymentConvention());
1007 
1008  bool hasCapsFloors = floatData->caps().size() > 0 || floatData->floors().size() > 0;
1009  vector<double> notionals = buildScheduledVectorNormalised(data.notionals(), data.notionalDates(), schedule, 0.0);
1010  vector<double> spreads =
1011  buildScheduledVectorNormalised(floatData->spreads(), floatData->spreadDates(), schedule, 0.0);
1012  vector<double> gearings =
1013  buildScheduledVectorNormalised(floatData->gearings(), floatData->gearingDates(), schedule, 1.0);
1014  Size fixingDays = floatData->fixingDays() == Null<Size>() ? index->fixingDays() : floatData->fixingDays();
1015  bool isInArrears = floatData->isInArrears() ? *floatData->isInArrears() : false;
1016 
1017  applyAmortization(notionals, data, schedule, true);
1018  // handle float annuity, which is not done in applyAmortization, for this we can only have one block
1019  if (!data.amortizationData().empty()) {
1020  AmortizationType amortizationType = parseAmortizationType(data.amortizationData().front().type());
1021  if (amortizationType == AmortizationType::Annuity) {
1022  LOG("Build floating annuity notional schedule");
1023  QL_REQUIRE(data.amortizationData().size() == 1,
1024  "Can have one AmortizationData block only for floating leg annuities");
1025  QL_REQUIRE(!hasCapsFloors, "Caps/Floors not supported in floating annuity coupons");
1026  QL_REQUIRE(floatData->gearings().size() == 0, "Gearings not supported in floating annuity coupons");
1027  DayCounter dc = index->dayCounter();
1028  Date startDate = data.amortizationData().front().startDate().empty()
1029  ? Date::minDate()
1030  : parseDate(data.amortizationData().front().startDate());
1031  double annuity = data.amortizationData().front().value();
1032  bool underflow = data.amortizationData().front().underflow();
1033  vector<boost::shared_ptr<Coupon>> coupons;
1034  for (Size i = 0; i < schedule.size() - 1; i++) {
1035  Date paymentDate = paymentCalendar.adjust(schedule[i + 1], bdc);
1036  if (schedule[i] < startDate || i == 0) {
1037  boost::shared_ptr<FloatingRateCoupon> coupon;
1038  if (!floatData->hasSubPeriods()) {
1039  coupon = boost::make_shared<IborCoupon>(paymentDate, notionals[i], schedule[i], schedule[i + 1],
1040  fixingDays, index, gearings[i], spreads[i], Date(),
1041  Date(), dc, isInArrears);
1042  coupon->setPricer(boost::make_shared<BlackIborCouponPricer>());
1043  } else {
1044  coupon = boost::make_shared<QuantExt::SubPeriodsCoupon1>(
1045  paymentDate, notionals[i], schedule[i], schedule[i + 1], index,
1046  floatData->isAveraged() ? QuantExt::SubPeriodsCoupon1::Averaging
1047  : QuantExt::SubPeriodsCoupon1::Compounding,
1048  index->businessDayConvention(), spreads[i], dc, floatData->includeSpread(), gearings[i]);
1049  coupon->setPricer(boost::make_shared<QuantExt::SubPeriodsCouponPricer1>());
1050  }
1051  coupons.push_back(coupon);
1052  LOG("FloatingAnnuityCoupon: " << i << " " << coupon->nominal() << " " << coupon->amount());
1053  } else {
1054  QL_REQUIRE(coupons.size() > 0,
1055  "FloatingAnnuityCoupon needs at least one predecessor, e.g. a plain IborCoupon");
1056  LOG("FloatingAnnuityCoupon, previous nominal/coupon: " << i << " " << coupons.back()->nominal()
1057  << " " << coupons.back()->amount());
1058  boost::shared_ptr<QuantExt::FloatingAnnuityCoupon> coupon =
1059  boost::make_shared<QuantExt::FloatingAnnuityCoupon>(
1060  annuity, underflow, coupons.back(), paymentDate, schedule[i], schedule[i + 1], fixingDays,
1061  index, gearings[i], spreads[i], Date(), Date(), dc, isInArrears);
1062  coupons.push_back(coupon);
1063  LOG("FloatingAnnuityCoupon: " << i << " " << coupon->nominal() << " " << coupon->amount());
1064  }
1065  }
1066  Leg leg;
1067  for (Size i = 0; i < coupons.size(); i++)
1068  leg.push_back(coupons[i]);
1069  LOG("Floating annuity notional schedule done");
1070  return leg;
1071  }
1072  }
1073 
1074  if (floatData->hasSubPeriods()) {
1075  QL_REQUIRE(floatData->caps().empty() && floatData->floors().empty(),
1076  "SubPeriodsLegs does not support caps or floors");
1077  QL_REQUIRE(!isInArrears, "SubPeriodLegs do not support in arrears fixings");
1078  Leg leg = QuantExt::SubPeriodsLeg1(schedule, index)
1079  .withNotionals(notionals)
1080  .withPaymentDayCounter(dc)
1081  .withPaymentAdjustment(bdc)
1082  .withGearings(gearings)
1083  .withSpreads(spreads)
1084  .withType(floatData->isAveraged() ? QuantExt::SubPeriodsCoupon1::Averaging
1085  : QuantExt::SubPeriodsCoupon1::Compounding)
1086  .includeSpread(floatData->includeSpread());
1087  QuantExt::setCouponPricer(leg, boost::make_shared<QuantExt::SubPeriodsCouponPricer1>());
1088  return leg;
1089  }
1090 
1091  PaymentLag paymentLag = parsePaymentLag(data.paymentLag());
1092  IborLeg iborLeg = IborLeg(schedule, index)
1093  .withNotionals(notionals)
1094  .withSpreads(spreads)
1095  .withPaymentCalendar(paymentCalendar)
1096  .withPaymentDayCounter(dc)
1097  .withPaymentAdjustment(bdc)
1098  .withFixingDays(fixingDays)
1099  .inArrears(isInArrears)
1100  .withGearings(gearings)
1101  .withPaymentLag(boost::apply_visitor(PaymentLagInteger(), paymentLag));
1102 
1103  // If no caps or floors or in arrears fixing, return the leg
1104  if (!hasCapsFloors && !isInArrears)
1105  return iborLeg;
1106 
1107  // If there are caps or floors or in arrears fixing, add them and set pricer
1108  if (floatData->caps().size() > 0)
1109  iborLeg.withCaps(buildScheduledVector(floatData->caps(), floatData->capDates(), schedule));
1110 
1111  if (floatData->floors().size() > 0)
1112  iborLeg.withFloors(buildScheduledVector(floatData->floors(), floatData->floorDates(), schedule));
1113 
1114  if (!attachPricer)
1115  return iborLeg;
1116 
1117  // Get a coupon pricer for the leg
1118  boost::shared_ptr<EngineBuilder> builder = engineFactory->builder("CapFlooredIborLeg");
1119  QL_REQUIRE(builder, "No builder found for CapFlooredIborLeg");
1120  boost::shared_ptr<CapFlooredIborLegEngineBuilder> cappedFlooredIborBuilder =
1121  boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<CapFlooredIborLegEngineBuilder>(builder);
1122  boost::shared_ptr<FloatingRateCouponPricer> couponPricer =
1123  cappedFlooredIborBuilder->engine(IndexNameTranslator::instance().oreName(index->name()));
1124 
1125  // Loop over the coupons in the leg and set pricer
1126  Leg tmpLeg = iborLeg;
1127  QuantLib::setCouponPricer(tmpLeg, couponPricer);
1128 
1129  // build naked option leg if required
1130  if (floatData->nakedOption()) {
1131  tmpLeg = StrippedCappedFlooredCouponLeg(tmpLeg);
1132  // fix for missing registration in ql 1.13
1133  for (auto const& t : tmpLeg) {
1134  auto s = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<StrippedCappedFlooredCoupon>(t);
1135  if (s != nullptr)
1136  s->registerWith(s->underlying());
1137  }
1138  }
1139  return tmpLeg;
1140 }

◆ makeNotionalLeg()

Leg makeNotionalLeg ( const Leg &  refLeg,
const bool  initNomFlow,
const bool  finalNomFlow,
const bool  amortNomFlow,
const BusinessDayConvention  paymentConvention,
const Calendar  paymentCalendar 
)

Definition at line 1299 of file legdata.cpp.

1300  {
1301 
1302  // Assumption - Cashflows on Input Leg are all coupons
1303  // This is the Leg to be populated
1304  Leg leg;
1305 
1306  // Initial Flow Amount
1307  if (initNomFlow) {
1308  auto coupon = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<QuantLib::Coupon>(refLeg[0]);
1309  QL_REQUIRE(coupon, "makeNotionalLeg does not support non-coupon legs");
1310  double initFlowAmt = coupon->nominal();
1311  Date initDate = coupon->accrualStartDate();
1312  initDate = paymentCalendar.adjust(initDate, paymentConvention);
1313  if (initFlowAmt != 0)
1314  leg.push_back(boost::shared_ptr<CashFlow>(new SimpleCashFlow(-initFlowAmt, initDate)));
1315  }
1316 
1317  // Amortization Flows
1318  if (amortNomFlow) {
1319  for (Size i = 1; i < refLeg.size(); i++) {
1320  auto coupon = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<QuantLib::Coupon>(refLeg[i]);
1321  QL_REQUIRE(coupon, "makeNotionalLeg does not support non-coupon legs");
1322  auto coupon2 = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<QuantLib::Coupon>(refLeg[i - 1]);
1323  QL_REQUIRE(coupon, "makeNotionalLeg does not support non-coupon legs");
1324  Date flowDate = coupon->accrualStartDate();
1325  flowDate = paymentCalendar.adjust(flowDate, paymentConvention);
1326  Real initNom = coupon2->nominal();
1327  Real newNom = coupon->nominal();
1328  Real flow = initNom - newNom;
1329  if (flow != 0)
1330  leg.push_back(boost::shared_ptr<CashFlow>(new SimpleCashFlow(flow, flowDate)));
1331  }
1332  }
1333 
1334  // Final Nominal Return at Maturity
1335  if (finalNomFlow) {
1336  // boost::shared_ptr<QuantLib::Coupon> coupon = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<QuantLib::Coupon>(refLeg.back());
1337  // if (coupon) {
1338  // double finalNomFlow = coupon->nominal();
1339  // Date finalDate = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<QuantLib::Coupon>(refLeg.back())->date();
1340  // if (finalNomFlow != 0)
1341  // leg.push_back(boost::shared_ptr<CashFlow>(new SimpleCashFlow(finalNomFlow, finalDate)));
1342  // } else {
1343  // ALOG("The reference leg's last cash flow is not a coupon, we cannot create a final exchange flow");
1344  // }
1345  auto coupon = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<QuantLib::Coupon>(refLeg.back());
1346  QL_REQUIRE(coupon, "makeNotionalLeg does not support non-coupon legs");
1347  double finalNomFlow = coupon->nominal();
1348  Date finalDate = coupon->accrualEndDate();
1349  finalDate = paymentCalendar.adjust(finalDate, paymentConvention);
1350  if (finalNomFlow != 0)
1351  leg.push_back(boost::shared_ptr<CashFlow>(new SimpleCashFlow(finalNomFlow, finalDate)));
1352  }
1353 
1354  return leg;
1355 }

1415  engineFactory->configuration(MarketContext::pricing)),

1425 
1426  // the cpi leg uses the first schedule date as the start date, which only makes sense if there are at least
1427  // two dates in the schedule, otherwise the only date in the schedule is the pay date of the cf and a a separate
1428  // start date is expected; if both the separate start date and a schedule with more than one date is given
1429  const string& start = cpiLegData->startDate();
1430  if (schedule.size() < 2) {
1431  QL_REQUIRE(!start.empty(), "makeCPILeg(): only one schedule date, a 'StartDate' must be given.");
1432  cpiLeg.withStartDate(parseDate(start));
1433  } else if (!start.empty()) {
1434  DLOG("Schedule with more than 2 dates was provided. The first schedule date "
1435 
1436  << io::iso_date(schedule.dates().front()) << " is used as the start date. The 'StartDate' of " << start
1437  << " is not used.");
1438  }
1439  if (couponCap)
1440  cpiLeg.withCaps(buildScheduledVector(cpiLegData->caps(), cpiLegData->capDates(), schedule));
1441 
1442  if (couponFloor)
1443  cpiLeg.withFloors(buildScheduledVector(cpiLegData->floors(), cpiLegData->floorDates(), schedule));
1444

1476  // nothing to do for the plain CPI CashFlow either, because it does not require a pricer
1477

1479  boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<CappedFlooredCPICoupon>(leg[i]);

1489  }
1490  }
1491

1493  // If Notional Exchange set to false, remove the final cashflow.
1494  if (!data.notionalFinalExchange()) {

1496  // boost::shared_ptr<CPICashFlow> cpicf = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<CPICashFlow>(leg[n - 1]);

1498  // identical by construction, see QuantLib::CPILeg or QuantExt::CPILeg.
1499  // Moreover, we may have no coupons and just a single fow at the end so that leg[n - 2] causes a problem.

1502  // leg.pop_back();

1509  }
1510 
1511  return leg;
1512 }

1735  {
1736  boost::shared_ptr<CMBLegData> cmbData = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<CMBLegData>(data.concreteLegData());
1737  QL_REQUIRE(cmbData, "Wrong LegType, expected CMB, got " << data.legType());
1738 
1739  std::string bondIndexName = cmbData->genericBond();
1740  // Expected bondIndexName structure with at least two tokens, separated by "-", of the form FAMILY-TERM or FAMILY-MUN, for example:
1741  // US-CMT-5Y, US-TIPS-10Y, UK-GILT-5Y, DE-BUND-10Y
1742  std::vector<string> tokens;
1743  split(tokens, bondIndexName, boost::is_any_of("-"));
1744  QL_REQUIRE(tokens.size() >= 2, "Generic Bond Index with at least two tokens separated by - expected, found " << bondIndexName);
1745  std::string securityFamily = tokens[0];
1746  for (Size i = 1; i < tokens.size() - 1; ++i)
1747  securityFamily = securityFamily + "-" + tokens[i];
1748  string underlyingTerm = tokens.back();
1749  Period underlyingPeriod = parsePeriod(underlyingTerm);
1750  LOG("Generic bond id " << bondIndexName << " has family " << securityFamily << " and term " << underlyingPeriod);
1751

1753  Calendar calendar = schedule.calendar();
1754  int fixingDays = cmbData->fixingDays();
1755  BusinessDayConvention convention = schedule.businessDayConvention();
1756  bool creditRisk = cmbData->hasCreditRisk();
1757 
1758  // Get the generic bond reference data, notional 1, credit risk as specified in the leg data
1759  BondData bondData(securityFamily, 1.0, creditRisk);
1760  bondData.populateFromBondReferenceData(engineFactory->referenceData());
1761  DLOG("Bond data for security id " << securityFamily << " loaded");
1762  QL_REQUIRE(bondData.coupons().size() == 1,
1763  "multiple reference bond legs not covered by the CMB leg");

1769  // Get bond yield conventions
1770  auto ret = InstrumentConventions::instance().conventions()->get(securityFamily, Convention::Type::BondYield);
1771  boost::shared_ptr<BondYieldConvention> conv;
1772  if (ret.first)
1773  conv = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<BondYieldConvention>(ret.second);
1774  else {
1775  conv = boost::make_shared<BondYieldConvention>();
1776  ALOG("BondYield conventions not found for security " << securityFamily << ", falling back on defaults:"
1777  << " compounding=" << conv->compoundingName()
1778  << ", priceType=" << conv->priceTypeName()
1779  << ", accuracy=" << conv->accuracy()
1780  << ", maxEvaluations=" << conv->maxEvaluations()
1781  << ", guess=" << conv->guess());
1782  }
1783 
1784  Schedule bondSchedule = makeSchedule(bondData.coupons().front().schedule());
1785  DayCounter bondDayCounter = parseDayCounter(bondData.coupons().front().dayCounter());
1786  Currency bondCurrency = parseCurrency(bondData.currency());
1787  Calendar bondCalendar = parseCalendar(bondData.calendar());
1788  Size bondSettlementDays = parseInteger(bondData.settlementDays());
1789  BusinessDayConvention bondConvention = bondSchedule.businessDayConvention();
1790  bool bondEndOfMonth = bondSchedule.endOfMonth();
1791  Frequency bondFrequency = bondSchedule.tenor().frequency();
1792 
1793  DayCounter dayCounter = parseDayCounter(data.dayCounter());
1794 
1795  // Create a ConstantMaturityBondIndex for each schedule start date
1796  DLOG("Create Constant Maturity Bond Indices for each period");
1797  std::vector<boost::shared_ptr<QuantExt::ConstantMaturityBondIndex>> bondIndices;
1798  for (Size i = 0; i < schedule.dates().size() - 1; ++i) {
1799  // Construct bond with start date = accrual start date and maturity = accrual start date + term
1800  // or start = accrual end if in arrears. Adjusted for fixing lag, ignoring bond settlement lags for now.
1801  Date refDate = cmbData->isInArrears() ? schedule[i+1] : schedule[i];
1802  Date start = calendar.advance(refDate, -fixingDays, Days, Preceding);
1803  std::string startDate = to_string(start);
1804  std::string endDate = to_string(start + underlyingPeriod);
1805  bondData.populateFromBondReferenceData(engineFactory->referenceData(), startDate, endDate);
1806  Bond bondTrade(Envelope(), bondData);
1807  bondTrade.build(engineFactory);
1808  auto bond = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<QuantLib::Bond>(bondTrade.instrument()->qlInstrument());
1809  boost::shared_ptr<QuantExt::ConstantMaturityBondIndex> bondIndex
1810  = boost::make_shared<QuantExt::ConstantMaturityBondIndex>(securityFamily, underlyingPeriod,
1811  // from bond reference data
1812  bondSettlementDays, bondCurrency, bondCalendar, bondDayCounter, bondConvention, bondEndOfMonth,
1813  // underlying forward starting bond
1814  bond,
1815  // yield calculation parameters from conventions, except frequency which is from bond reference data
1816  conv->compounding(), bondFrequency, conv->accuracy(), conv->maxEvaluations(), conv->guess(), conv->priceType());
1817  bondIndices.push_back(bondIndex);
1818  }
1819 
1820  // Create a sequence of floating rate coupons linked to those indexes and concatenate them to a leg
1821  DLOG("Create CMB leg");
1822  vector<double> spreads = buildScheduledVectorNormalised(cmbData->spreads(), cmbData->spreadDates(), schedule, 0.0);
1823  vector<double> gearings = buildScheduledVectorNormalised(cmbData->gearings(), cmbData->gearingDates(), schedule, 1.0);
1824  vector<double> notionals = buildScheduledVectorNormalised(data.notionals(), data.notionalDates(), schedule, 0.0);
1825 
1826  // FIXME: Move the following into CmbLeg in cmbcoupon.xpp
1827  QL_REQUIRE(bondIndices.size() == schedule.size() - 1,
1828  "vector size mismatch between schedule (" << schedule.size() << ") "
1829  << "and bond indices (" << bondIndices.size() << ")");
1830  Leg leg;
1831  for (Size i = 0; i < schedule.size() - 1; i++) {
1832  Date paymentDate = calendar.adjust(schedule[i + 1], convention);
1833  DLOG("Coupon " << i << ": "
1834  << io::iso_date(paymentDate) << " "
1835  << notionals[i] << " "
1836  << io::iso_date(schedule[i]) << " "
1837  << io::iso_date(schedule[i+1]) << " "
1838  << cmbData->fixingDays() << " "
1839  << gearings[i] << " "
1840  << spreads[i] << " "
1841  << dayCounter.name());
1842  boost::shared_ptr<CmbCoupon> coupon
1843  = boost::make_shared<CmbCoupon>(paymentDate, notionals[i], schedule[i], schedule[i + 1],
1844  cmbData->fixingDays(), bondIndices[i], gearings[i], spreads[i], Date(), Date(),
1845  dayCounter, cmbData->isInArrears());
1846  auto pricer = boost::make_shared<CmbCouponPricer>();
1847  coupon->setPricer(pricer);
1848  leg.push_back(coupon);
1849  }
1850 
1851  return leg;
1852 }

1933  cmsBuilder->engine(IndexNameTranslator::instance().oreName(swapIndex->iborIndex()->name())));
1934  QL_REQUIRE(cmsPricer, "Expected CMS Pricer");

1997  IndexNameTranslator::instance().oreName(swapSpreadIndex->swapIndex1()->iborIndex()->name())));

2004  QL_REQUIRE(cmsSpreadPricer, "Expected CMS Spread Pricer");

2012  tmpLeg = StrippedCappedFlooredCouponLeg(tmpLeg);
2013  // fix for missing registration in ql 1.13

2015  auto s = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<StrippedCappedFlooredCoupon>(t);
2016  if (s != nullptr)
2017  s->registerWith(s->underlying());
2018  }
2019  }
2020  return tmpLeg;
2021 }

◆ currentNotional()

Real currentNotional ( const Leg &  leg)

Definition at line 2206 of file legdata.cpp.

2206  {
2207  Date today = Settings::instance().evaluationDate();
2208  // assume the leg is sorted
2209  // We just take the first coupon::nominal we find, otherwise return 0
2210  for (auto cf : leg) {
2211  if (cf->date() > today) {
2212  boost::shared_ptr<Coupon> coupon = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<QuantLib::Coupon>(cf);
2213  if (coupon)
2214  return coupon->nominal();
2215  }
2216  }

◆ originalNotional()

Real originalNotional ( const Leg &  leg)

2220  {
2221  // assume the leg is sorted
2222  // We just take the first coupon::nominal we find, otherwise return 0
2223  if (leg.size() > 0) {
2224  boost::shared_ptr<Coupon> coupon = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<QuantLib::Coupon>(leg.front());
2225  if (coupon)
2226  return coupon->nominal();
2227  }
2228  return 0;
2229 }

2235  Date startDate = data.startDate().empty() ? Date::minDate() : parseDate(data.startDate());
2236  Date endDate = data.endDate().empty() ? Date::maxDate() : parseDate(data.endDate());

2242  if (i > 0 && (lastAmortDate == Date::minDate() || schedule[i] > lastAmortDate + amortPeriod - 4 * Days) &&
2243  schedule[i] >= startDate && schedule[i] < endDate) { // FIXME: tolerance

2245  lastAmortDate = schedule[i];

2248  }

2250  amort = std::max(nominals[i], 0.0);

◆ buildAmortizationScheduleFixedAnnuity()

vector< double > buildAmortizationScheduleFixedAnnuity ( const vector< double > &  notionals,
const vector< double > &  rates,
const Schedule &  schedule,
const AmortizationData &  data,
const DayCounter &  dc 
)

Definition at line 2306 of file legdata.cpp.

2308  {
2309  DLOG("Build fixed annuity notional schedule");
2310  vector<double> nominals = normaliseToSchedule(notionals, schedule, (Real)Null<Real>());
2311  Date startDate = data.startDate().empty() ? Date::minDate() : parseDate(data.startDate());
2312  Date endDate = data.endDate().empty() ? Date::maxDate() : parseDate(data.endDate());
2313  bool underflow = data.underflow();
2314  double annuity = data.value();
2315  Real amort = 0.0;
2316  Date lastAmortDate = Date::minDate();
2317  for (Size i = 0; i < schedule.size() - 1; i++) {
2318  if (i > 0 && schedule[i] >= startDate && schedule[i] < endDate) {
2319  nominals[i] = nominals[i - 1] - amort;
2320  lastAmortDate = schedule[i];
2321  } else if (i > 0 && lastAmortDate > Date::minDate())
2322  nominals[i] = nominals[i - 1];
2323  Real dcf = dc.yearFraction(schedule[i], schedule[i + 1]);
2324  Real rate = i < rates.size() ? rates[i] : rates.back();
2325  amort = annuity - rate * nominals[i] * dcf;
2326  if (amort > nominals[i] && underflow == false) {
2327  amort = std::max(nominals[i], 0.0);
2328  }
2329  }
2330  DLOG("Fixed Annuity notional schedule done");
2331  return nominals;
2332 }

◆ buildAmortizationScheduleLinearToMaturity()

vector<double> ore::data::buildAmortizationScheduleLinearToMaturity ( const vector< double > &  notionals,
const Schedule &  schedule,
const AmortizationData &  data 
)

Definition at line 2334 of file legdata.cpp.

2335  {
2336  DLOG("Build linear-to-maturity notional schedule");
2337  vector<double> nominals = normaliseToSchedule(notionals, schedule, (Real)Null<Real>());
2338  Date startDate = data.startDate().empty() ? Date::minDate() : parseDate(data.startDate());
2339  Date endDate = data.endDate().empty() ? Date::maxDate() : parseDate(data.endDate());
2340  Period amortPeriod = data.frequency().empty() ? 0 * Days : parsePeriod(data.frequency());
2341  Date lastAmortDate = Date::minDate();
2342  Real periodAmortization = Null<Real>();
2343  Real accumulatedAmortization = 0.0;
2344  for (Size i = 0; i < schedule.size() - 1; ++i) {
2345  if (schedule[i] >= startDate && periodAmortization == Null<Real>()) {
2346  periodAmortization = nominals[i] / static_cast<Real>(schedule.size() - i);
2347  }
2348  if (i > 0 && schedule[i] >= startDate && schedule[i] < endDate) {
2349  accumulatedAmortization += periodAmortization;
2350  }
2351  if (i > 0 && (lastAmortDate == Date::minDate() || schedule[i] > lastAmortDate + amortPeriod - 4 * Days) &&
2352  schedule[i] >= startDate && schedule[i] < endDate) {
2353  nominals[i] = nominals[i - 1] - accumulatedAmortization;
2354  accumulatedAmortization = 0.0;
2355  lastAmortDate = schedule[i];
2356  } else if (i > 0 && lastAmortDate > Date::minDate()) {
2357  nominals[i] = nominals[i - 1];
2358  }
2359  }
2360  DLOG("Linear-to-maturity notional schedule done");
2361  return nominals;
2362 }

2398  QL_REQUIRE(data.amortizationData().size() == 1,
2399  "Floating Leg supports only one amortisation block of type Annuity");

2401  }

Definition at line 2404 of file legdata.cpp.

2406  {
2407  for (auto const& indexing : data.indexing()) {
2408  if (indexing.hasData()) {
2409  DLOG("apply indexing (index='" << indexing.index() << "') to leg of type " << data.legType());
2410  QL_REQUIRE(engineFactory, "applyIndexing: engineFactory required");
2411 
2412  // we allow indexing by equity, commodity and FX indices (technically any QuantLib::Index
2413  // will work, so the list of index types can be extended here if required)
2414  boost::shared_ptr<Index> index;
2415  string config = engineFactory->configuration(MarketContext::pricing);
2416  if (boost::starts_with(indexing.index(), "EQ-")) {
2417  string eqName = indexing.index().substr(3);
2418  index = *engineFactory->market()->equityCurve(eqName, config);
2419  } else if (boost::starts_with(indexing.index(), "FX-")) {
2420  auto tmp = parseFxIndex(indexing.index());
2421  Currency ccy1 = tmp->targetCurrency();
2422  Currency ccy2 = tmp->sourceCurrency();
2423  QL_REQUIRE(ccy1.code() == data.currency() || ccy2.code() == data.currency(),
2424  "applyIndexing: fx index '" << indexing.index() << "' ccys do not match leg ccy ("
2425  << data.currency() << ")");
2426  std::string domestic = data.currency();
2427  std::string foreign = ccy1.code() == domestic ? ccy2.code() : ccy1.code();
2428  index = buildFxIndex(indexing.index(), domestic, foreign, engineFactory->market(),
2429  engineFactory->configuration(MarketContext::pricing));
2430 
2431  } else if (boost::starts_with(indexing.index(), "COMM-")) {
2432  auto tmp = parseCommodityIndex(indexing.index());
2433  index = parseCommodityIndex(indexing.index(), true,
2434  engineFactory->market()->commodityPriceCurve(tmp->underlyingName(), config),
2435  tmp->fixingCalendar());
2436  } else if (boost::starts_with(indexing.index(), "BOND-")) {
2437  // if we build a bond index, we add the required fixings for the bond underlying
2438  boost::shared_ptr<BondIndex> bi = parseBondIndex(indexing.index());
2439  QL_REQUIRE(!(boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<BondFuturesIndex>(bi)),
2440  "BondFuture Legs are not yet supported");
2441  BondData bondData(bi->securityName(), 1.0);
2442  index = buildBondIndex(bondData, indexing.indexIsDirty(), indexing.indexIsRelative(),
2443  parseCalendar(indexing.fixingCalendar()),
2444  indexing.indexIsConditionalOnSurvival(), engineFactory, requiredFixings);
2445  } else {
2446  QL_FAIL("invalid index '" << indexing.index()
2447  << "' in indexing data, expected EQ-, FX-, COMM-, BOND- index");
2448  }
2449 
2450  QL_REQUIRE(index, "applyIndexing(): index is null, this is unexpected");
2451 
2452  // apply the indexing
2453  IndexedCouponLeg indLeg(leg, indexing.quantity(), index);
2454  indLeg.withInitialFixing(indexing.initialFixing());
2455  indLeg.withFixingDays(indexing.fixingDays());
2456  indLeg.inArrearsFixing(indexing.inArrearsFixing());
2457  if (indexing.valuationSchedule().hasData())
2458  indLeg.withValuationSchedule(makeSchedule(indexing.valuationSchedule(), openEndDateReplacement));
2459  if (!indexing.fixingCalendar().empty())
2460  indLeg.withFixingCalendar(parseCalendar(indexing.fixingCalendar()));
2461  if (!indexing.fixingConvention().empty())
2462  indLeg.withFixingConvention(parseBusinessDayConvention(indexing.fixingConvention()));
2463  leg = indLeg;
2464 
2465  // add to the qlToOREIndexNames map
2466  qlToOREIndexNames[index->name()] = indexing.index();
2467  }
2468  }
2469 }

2528

2530  defaultCurve = Handle<DefaultProbabilityTermStructure>();
2531  }
2532

2534
