◆ joinLegs()

Leg joinLegs ( const std::vector< Leg > &  legs)

Definition at line 2540 of file legdata.cpp.

2540  {
2541  Leg masterLeg;
2542  Size lastLeg = Null<Size>();
2543  for (Size i = 0; i < legs.size(); ++i) {
2544  // skip empty legs
2545  if (legs[i].empty())
2546  continue;
2547  // check if the periods of adjacent legs are consistent
2548  if (lastLeg != Null<Size>()) {
2549  auto lcpn = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<Coupon>(legs[lastLeg].back());
2550  auto fcpn = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<Coupon>(legs[i].front());
2551  QL_REQUIRE(lcpn, "joinLegs: expected coupon as last cashflow in leg #" << lastLeg);
2552  QL_REQUIRE(fcpn, "joinLegs: expected coupon as first cashflow in leg #" << i);
2553  QL_REQUIRE(lcpn->accrualEndDate() == fcpn->accrualStartDate(),
2554  "joinLegs: accrual end date of last coupon in leg #"
2555  << lastLeg << " (" << lcpn->accrualEndDate()
2556  << ") is not equal to accrual start date of first coupon in leg #" << i << " ("
2557  << fcpn->accrualStartDate() << ")");
2558  lastLeg = i;
2559  }
2560  // copy legs together
2561  masterLeg.insert(masterLeg.end(), legs[i].begin(), legs[i].end());
2562  }
2563  return masterLeg;
2564 }

◆ buildNotionalLeg()

Leg buildNotionalLeg ( const LegData &  data,
const Leg &  leg,
RequiredFixings &  requiredFixings,
const boost::shared_ptr< Market > &  market,
const std::string &  configuration 
)

Definition at line 2566 of file legdata.cpp.

2567  {
2568 
2569  if (!data.isNotResetXCCY()) {
2570  // If we have an FX resetting leg, add the notional amount at the start and end of each coupon period.
2571  DLOG("Building Resetting XCCY Notional leg");
2572  Real foreignNotional = data.foreignAmount();
2573 
2574  QL_REQUIRE(!data.fxIndex().empty(), "buildNotionalLeg(): need fx index for fx resetting leg");
2575  auto fxIndex =
2576  buildFxIndex(data.fxIndex(), data.currency(), data.foreignCurrency(), market, configuration, true);
2577 
2578  Leg resettingLeg;
2579  for (Size j = 0; j < leg.size(); j++) {
2580 
2581  boost::shared_ptr<Coupon> c = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<Coupon>(leg[j]);
2582  QL_REQUIRE(c, "Expected each cashflow in FX resetting leg to be of type Coupon");
2583 
2584  // Build a pair of notional flows, one at the start and one at the end of the accrual period.
2585  // They both have the same FX fixing date => same amount in this leg's currency.
2586  boost::shared_ptr<CashFlow> outCf;
2587  boost::shared_ptr<CashFlow> inCf;
2588  Date fixingDate;
2589  if (j == 0) {
2590  // Two possibilities for first coupon:
2591  // 1. we have not been given a domestic notional so it is an FX linked coupon
2592  // 2. we have been given an explicit domestic notional so it is a simple cashflow
2593  if (data.notionals().size() == 0) {
2594  fixingDate = fxIndex->fixingDate(c->accrualStartDate());
2595  if (data.notionalInitialExchange()) {
2596  outCf = boost::make_shared<FXLinkedCashFlow>(c->accrualStartDate(), fixingDate,
2597  -foreignNotional, fxIndex);
2598  }
2599  // if there is only one period we generate the cash flow at the period end
2600  // only if there is a final notional exchange
2601  if (leg.size() > 1 || data.notionalFinalExchange()) {
2602  inCf = boost::make_shared<FXLinkedCashFlow>(c->accrualEndDate(), fixingDate, foreignNotional,
2603  fxIndex);
2604  }
2605  } else {
2606  if (data.notionalInitialExchange()) {
2607  outCf = boost::make_shared<SimpleCashFlow>(-c->nominal(), c->accrualStartDate());
2608  }
2609  if (leg.size() > 1 || data.notionalFinalExchange()) {
2610  inCf = boost::make_shared<SimpleCashFlow>(c->nominal(), c->accrualEndDate());
2611  }
2612  }
2613  } else {
2614  fixingDate = fxIndex->fixingDate(c->accrualStartDate());
2615  outCf =
2616  boost::make_shared<FXLinkedCashFlow>(c->accrualStartDate(), fixingDate, -foreignNotional, fxIndex);
2617  // we don't want a final one, unless there is notional exchange
2618  if (j < leg.size() - 1 || data.notionalFinalExchange()) {
2619  inCf =
2620  boost::make_shared<FXLinkedCashFlow>(c->accrualEndDate(), fixingDate, foreignNotional, fxIndex);
2621  }
2622  }
2623 
2624  // Add the cashflows to the notional leg if they have been populated
2625  if (outCf) {
2626  resettingLeg.push_back(outCf);
2627  if (fixingDate != Date())
2628  requiredFixings.addFixingDate(fixingDate, data.fxIndex(), outCf->date());
2629  }
2630  if (inCf) {
2631  resettingLeg.push_back(inCf);
2632  if (fixingDate != Date())
2633  requiredFixings.addFixingDate(fixingDate, data.fxIndex(), inCf->date());
2634  }
2635  }
2636 
2637  if (data.notionalAmortizingExchange()) {
2638  QL_FAIL("Cannot have an amortizing notional with FX reset");
2639  }
2640 
2641  return resettingLeg;
2642 
2643  } else if ((data.notionalInitialExchange() || data.notionalFinalExchange() || data.notionalAmortizingExchange()) &&
2644  (data.legType() != "CPI")) {
2645 
2646  // check for notional exchanges on non FX reseting trades
2647 
2648  return makeNotionalLeg(leg, data.notionalInitialExchange(), data.notionalFinalExchange(),
2649  data.notionalAmortizingExchange(), parseBusinessDayConvention(data.paymentConvention()),
2650  parseCalendar(data.paymentCalendar()));
2651  } else {
2652  return Leg();
2653  }

◆ buildScheduledVector()

vector< T > buildScheduledVector ( const vector< T > &  values,
const vector< string > &  dates,
const Schedule &  schedule,
const bool  checkAllValuesAppearInResult = false 
)

Build a full vector of values from the given node.

Definition at line 1062 of file legdata.hpp.

1063  {
1064  if (values.size() < 2 || dates.size() == 0)
1065  return values;
1066 
1067  QL_REQUIRE(values.size() == dates.size(), "Value / Date size mismatch in buildScheduledVector."
1068  << "Value:" << values.size() << ", Dates:" << dates.size());
1069 
1070  // Need to use schedule logic
1071  // Length of data will be 1 less than schedule
1072  //
1073  // Notional 100
1074  // Notional {startDate 2015-01-01} 200
1075  // Notional {startDate 2016-01-01} 300
1076  //
1077  // Given schedule June, Dec from 2014 to 2016 (6 dates, 5 coupons)
1078  // we return 100, 100, 200, 200, 300
1079 
1080  // The first node must not have a date.
1081  // If the second one has a date, all the rest must have, and we process
1082  // If the second one does not have a date, none of them must have one
1083  // and we return the vector unaffected.
1084  QL_REQUIRE(dates[0] == "", "Invalid date " << dates[0] << " for first node");
1085  if (dates[1] == "") {
1086  // They must all be empty and then we return values
1087  for (Size i = 2; i < dates.size(); i++) {
1088  QL_REQUIRE(dates[i] == "", "Invalid date " << dates[i] << " for node " << i
1089  << ". Cannot mix dates and non-dates attributes");
1090  }
1091  return values;
1092  }
1093 
1094  // We have nodes with date attributes now
1095  Size len = schedule.size() - 1;
1096  vector<T> data(len);
1097  Size j = 0, max_j = dates.size() - 1; // j is the index of date/value vector. 0 to max_j
1098  Date d = parseDate(dates[j + 1]); // The first start date
1099  for (Size i = 0; i < len; i++) { // loop over data vector and populate it.
1100  // If j == max_j we just fall through and take the final value
1101  while (schedule[i] >= d && j < max_j) {
1102  j++;
1103  if (j < max_j) {
1104  QL_REQUIRE(dates[j + 1] != "", "Cannot have empty date attribute for node " << j + 1);
1105  d = parseDate(dates[j + 1]);
1106  }
1107  }
1108  data[i] = values[j];
1109  }
1110 
1111  if (checkAllValuesAppearInResult) {
1112  auto it = checkAllValuesAppearInScheduledVector<T>(data, values);
1113  QL_REQUIRE(it == values.end(),
1114  "buildScheduledVector: input value '" << *it << " does not appear in the result vector");
1115  }
1116 
1117  return data;
1118 }

◆ makeSchedule() [1/7]

QuantLib::Schedule makeSchedule ( const ScheduleDates &  data)

Definition at line 203 of file schedule.cpp.

203  {
204  QL_REQUIRE(data.dates().size() > 0, "Must provide at least 1 date for Schedule");
205  Calendar calendar = parseCalendar(data.calendar());
206  BusinessDayConvention convention = ModifiedFollowing;
207  if (data.convention() != "")
208  convention = parseBusinessDayConvention(data.convention());
209  // Avoid compiler warning on gcc
210  // https://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_74_0/libs/optional/doc/html/boost_optional/tutorial/
211  // gotchas/false_positive_with__wmaybe_uninitialized.html
212  auto tenor = boost::make_optional(false, Period());
213  if (data.tenor() != "")
214  tenor = parsePeriod(data.tenor());
215  bool endOfMonth = false;
216  if (data.endOfMonth() != "")
217  endOfMonth = parseBool(data.endOfMonth());
218 
219  // Ensure that Schedule ctor is passed a vector of unique ordered dates.
220  std::set<Date> uniqueDates;
221  for (const string& d : data.dates())
222  uniqueDates.insert(calendar.adjust(parseDate(d), convention));
223 
224  return Schedule(vector<Date>(uniqueDates.begin(), uniqueDates.end()), calendar, convention, boost::none, tenor,
225  boost::none, endOfMonth);
226 }

◆ makeSchedule() [2/7]

Schedule ore::data::makeSchedule ( const ScheduleDerived &  data,
const Schedule &  baseSchedule 
)

Definition at line 228 of file schedule.cpp.

228  {
229 
230  string strCalendar = data.calendar();
231  Calendar calendar;
232  if (strCalendar.empty()) {
233  calendar = NullCalendar();
234  WLOG("No calendar provided in Schedule, attempting to use a null calendar.");
235  }
236  else
237  calendar = parseCalendar(strCalendar);
238 
239  BusinessDayConvention convention;
240  string strConvention = data.convention();
241  if (strConvention.empty())
242  convention = BusinessDayConvention::Unadjusted;
243  else
244  convention = parseBusinessDayConvention(strConvention);
245 
246  string strShift = data.shift();
247  Period shift;
248  if (strShift.empty())
249  shift = 0 * Days;
250  else
251  shift = parsePeriod(data.shift());
252 
253  const std::vector<QuantLib::Date>& baseDates = baseSchedule.dates();
254  std::vector<QuantLib::Date> derivedDates;
255  QuantLib::Date derivedDate;
256  for (const Date& d : baseDates) {
257  derivedDate = calendar.advance(d, shift, convention);
258  derivedDates.push_back(derivedDate);
259  }
260  return Schedule(vector<Date>(derivedDates.begin(), derivedDates.end()), calendar, convention, boost::none,
261  baseSchedule.tenor(), boost::none, baseSchedule.endOfMonth());
262 }

◆ makeSchedule() [3/7]

Schedule ore::data::makeSchedule ( const ScheduleRules &  data,
const Date &  openEndDateReplacement 
)

Definition at line 264 of file schedule.cpp.

264  {
265  QL_REQUIRE(!data.endDate().empty() || openEndDateReplacement != Null<Date>(),
266  "makeSchedule(): Schedule does not have an end date, this is not supported in this context / for this "
267  "trade type. Please provide an end date.");
268  QL_REQUIRE(!data.endDate().empty() || data.lastDate().empty(),
269  "makeSchedule(): If no end date is given, a last date is not allowed either. Please remove the last "
270  "date from the schedule.");
271  Calendar calendar = parseCalendar(data.calendar());
272  if (calendar == NullCalendar())
273  WLOG("No calendar provided in Schedule, attempting to use a null calendar.");
274  Date startDate = parseDate(data.startDate());
275  Date endDate = data.endDate().empty() ? openEndDateReplacement : parseDate(data.endDate());
276  // Handle trivial case here
277  if (startDate == endDate)
278  return Schedule(vector<Date>(1, startDate), calendar);
279 
280  QL_REQUIRE(startDate < endDate, "StartDate " << startDate << " is ahead of EndDate " << endDate);
281 
282  Date firstDate = parseDate(data.firstDate());
283  Date lastDate = parseDate(data.lastDate());
284  Period tenor = parsePeriod(data.tenor());
285 
286  // defaults
287  BusinessDayConvention bdc = ModifiedFollowing;
288  BusinessDayConvention bdcEnd = ModifiedFollowing;
289  DateGeneration::Rule rule = DateGeneration::Forward;
290  bool endOfMonth = false;
291 
292  // now check the strings, if they are empty we take defaults
293  if (!data.convention().empty())
294  bdc = parseBusinessDayConvention(data.convention());
295  if (!data.termConvention().empty())
296  bdcEnd = parseBusinessDayConvention(data.termConvention());
297  else
298  bdcEnd = bdc; // except here
299  if (!data.rule().empty())
300  rule = parseDateGenerationRule(data.rule());
301  if (!data.endOfMonth().empty())
302  endOfMonth = parseBool(data.endOfMonth());
303 
304  if ((rule == DateGeneration::CDS || rule == DateGeneration::CDS2015) &&
305  (firstDate != Null<Date>() || lastDate != Null<Date>())) {
306  // Special handling of first date and last date in combination with CDS and CDS2015 rules:
307  // To be able to construct CDS schedules with front or back stub periods, we overwrite the
308  // first (last) date of the schedule built in QL with a given first (last) date
309  // The schedule builder in QL itself is not capable of doing this, it just throws an exception
310  // if a first (last) date is given in combination with a CDS / CDS2015 date generation rule.
311  std::vector<Date> dates = Schedule(startDate, endDate, tenor, calendar, bdc, bdcEnd, rule, endOfMonth).dates();
312  QL_REQUIRE(!dates.empty(),
313  "got empty CDS or CDS2015 schedule, startDate = " << startDate << ", endDate = " << endDate);
314  if (firstDate != Date())
315  dates.front() = firstDate;
316  if (lastDate != Date())
317  dates.back() = lastDate;
318  return Schedule(dates, calendar, bdc, bdcEnd, tenor, rule, endOfMonth);
319  } else {
320  return Schedule(startDate, endDate, tenor, calendar, bdc, bdcEnd, rule, endOfMonth, firstDate, lastDate);
321  }
322 }
Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ makeSchedule() [4/7]

Schedule ore::data::makeSchedule ( const ScheduleData &  data,
const Date &  openEndDateReplacement,
const map< string, QuantLib::Schedule > &  baseSchedules 
)

Definition at line 342 of file schedule.cpp.

342  {
343  // only the last rule-based schedule is allowed to have an open end date, check this
344  for (Size i = 1; i < data.rules().size(); ++i) {
345  QL_REQUIRE(!data.rules()[i - 1].endDate().empty(),
346  "makeSchedule(): only last schedule is allowed to have an open end date");
347  }
348  // build all the date and rule based sub-schedules we have
349  vector<Schedule> schedules;
350  for (auto& d : data.dates())
351  schedules.push_back(makeSchedule(d));
352  for (auto& r : data.rules())
353  schedules.push_back(makeSchedule(r, openEndDateReplacement));
354  if (!baseSchedules.empty())
355  for (auto& dv : data.derived()) {
356  auto baseSchedule = baseSchedules.find(dv.baseSchedule());
357  QL_REQUIRE(baseSchedule != baseSchedules.end(), "makeSchedule(): could not find base schedule \"" << dv.baseSchedule() << "\"");
358  schedules.push_back(makeSchedule(dv, baseSchedule->second));
359  }
360  QL_REQUIRE(!schedules.empty(), "No dates or rules to build Schedule from");
361  if (schedules.size() == 1)
362  // if we have just one, use that (most common case)
363  return schedules.front();
364  else {
365  // if we have multiple, combine them
366 
367  // 1) sort by start date
368  std::sort(schedules.begin(), schedules.end(),
369  [](const Schedule& lhs, const Schedule& rhs) -> bool { return lhs.startDate() < rhs.startDate(); });
370 
371  // 2) check if meta data is present, and if yes if it is consistent across schedules;
372  // the only exception is the term date convention, this is taken from the last schedule always
373  BusinessDayConvention convention = Null<BusinessDayConvention>(),
374  termConvention = Unadjusted; // initialization prevents gcc warning
375  Calendar calendar;
376  Period tenor;
377  DateGeneration::Rule rule = DateGeneration::Zero; // initialization prevents gcc warning
378  bool endOfMonth = false; // initialization prevents gcc warning
379  bool hasCalendar = false, hasConvention = false, hasTermConvention = false, hasTenor = false, hasRule = false,
380  hasEndOfMonth = false, hasConsistentCalendar = true, hasConsistentConvention = true,
381  hasConsistentTenor = true, hasConsistentRule = true, hasConsistentEndOfMonth = true;
382  for (auto& d : data.dates()) {
383  updateData<Calendar>(d.calendar(), calendar, hasCalendar, hasConsistentCalendar, parseCalendarTemp);
384  updateData<BusinessDayConvention>(d.convention(), convention, hasConvention, hasConsistentConvention,
385  parseBusinessDayConvention);
386  updateData<Period>(d.tenor(), tenor, hasTenor, hasConsistentTenor, parsePeriod);
387  }
388  for (auto& d : data.rules()) {
389  updateData<Calendar>(d.calendar(), calendar, hasCalendar, hasConsistentCalendar, parseCalendarTemp);
390  updateData<BusinessDayConvention>(d.convention(), convention, hasConvention, hasConsistentConvention,
391  parseBusinessDayConvention);
392  updateData<Period>(d.tenor(), tenor, hasTenor, hasConsistentTenor, parsePeriod);
393  updateData<bool>(d.endOfMonth(), endOfMonth, hasEndOfMonth, hasConsistentEndOfMonth, parseBool);
394  updateData<DateGeneration::Rule>(d.rule(), rule, hasRule, hasConsistentRule, parseDateGenerationRule);
395  if (d.termConvention() != "") {
396  hasTermConvention = true;
397  termConvention = parseBusinessDayConvention(d.termConvention());
398  }
399  }
400 
401  // 3) combine dates and fill isRegular flag
402  const Schedule& s0 = schedules.front();
403  vector<Date> dates = s0.dates();
404  std::vector<bool> isRegular(s0.dates().size() - 1, false);
405  if (s0.hasIsRegular())
406  isRegular = s0.isRegular();
407  // will be removed, if next schedule's front date is matching the last date of current schedule
408  isRegular.push_back(false);
409  for (Size i = 1; i < schedules.size(); ++i) {
410  const Schedule& s = schedules[i];
411  QL_REQUIRE(dates.back() <= s.dates().front(), "Dates mismatch");
412  // if the end points match up, skip one to avoid duplicates, otherwise take both
413  Size offset = dates.back() == s.dates().front() ? 1 : 0;
414  isRegular.erase(isRegular.end() - offset,
415  isRegular.end()); // correct for superfluous flags from previous schedule
416  // add isRegular information, if available, otherwise assume irregular periods
417  if (s.hasIsRegular()) {
418  isRegular.insert(isRegular.end(), s.isRegular().begin(), s.isRegular().end());
419  } else {
420  for (Size ii = 0; ii < s.dates().size() - 1; ++ii)
421  isRegular.push_back(false);
422  }
423  if (i < schedules.size() - 1) {
424  // will be removed if next schedule's front date is matching last date of current schedule
425  isRegular.push_back(false);
426  }
427  // add the dates
428  dates.insert(dates.end(), s.dates().begin() + offset, s.dates().end());
429  }
430 
431  // 4) Build schedule
432  return Schedule(dates, hasCalendar && hasConsistentCalendar ? calendar : NullCalendar(),
433  hasConvention && hasConsistentConvention ? convention : Unadjusted,
434  hasTermConvention ? boost::optional<BusinessDayConvention>(termConvention) : boost::none,
435  hasTenor && hasConsistentTenor ? boost::optional<Period>(tenor) : boost::none,
436  hasRule && hasConsistentRule ? boost::optional<DateGeneration::Rule>(rule) : boost::none,
437  hasEndOfMonth && hasConsistentEndOfMonth ? boost::optional<bool>(endOfMonth) : boost::none,
438  isRegular);
439  }
440 }
Here is the call graph for this function:
Here is the caller graph for this function:

◆ parseCorrelationFactor()

CorrelationFactor parseCorrelationFactor ( const std::string &  name)

Parse a correlation factor name. For example, a name like IR:EUR is parsed to a CorrelationFactor with type, name and index set to IR, EUR and 0 respectively. Note that the name is of the form type:name and the index is always set to 0 initially. The actual index is set separately.

Definition at line 58 of file correlationmatrix.cpp.

58  {
59 
60  Size pos = name.find(':');
61  QL_REQUIRE(pos != string::npos, "Expected the factor to be of the form 'type:name'");
62 
63  CT::AssetType factorType = parseCamAssetType(name.substr(0, pos));
64  string factorName = name.substr(pos + 1);
65 
66  return { factorType, factorName, 0 };
67 }

◆ generateShiftedDateGrid()

boost::shared_ptr< DateGrid > generateShiftedDateGrid ( const boost::shared_ptr< DateGrid > &  dg,
const QuantLib::Period &  shift 
)

Definition at line 304 of file dategrid.cpp.

305  {
306  DLOG("Building shifted date grid with shift of " << shift);
307  vector<Date> defaultDates = dg->dates();
308  vector<Date> closeOutDates;
309  for (auto d : defaultDates) {
310  Date closeOut = dg->calendar().adjust(d + shift);
311  closeOutDates.push_back(closeOut);
312  }
313  boost::shared_ptr<DateGrid> newDg = boost::make_shared<DateGrid>(closeOutDates, dg->calendar(), dg->dayCounter());
314  return newDg;
315 }

318  {
319  DLOG("Combining date grids");
320  vector<Date> combinedVec;
321  vector<Date> dates1 = dg1->dates();
322  vector<Date> dates2 = dg2->dates();
323  combinedVec.reserve(dates1.size() + dates2.size());
324  combinedVec.insert(combinedVec.end(), dates1.begin(), dates1.end());
325  combinedVec.insert(combinedVec.end(), dates2.begin(), dates2.end());
326  std::sort(combinedVec.begin(), combinedVec.end());
327  auto last = std::unique(combinedVec.begin(), combinedVec.end());
328  combinedVec.erase(last, combinedVec.end());
329  // FIXME: Check that grid calendars and day counters match?
330  boost::shared_ptr<DateGrid> newDg = boost::make_shared<DateGrid>(combinedVec, dg1->calendar(), dg1->dayCounter());
331  return newDg;

◆ parseIborIndex()

boost::shared_ptr<IborIndex> ore::data::parseIborIndex ( const string &  s,
string &  tenor,
const Handle< YieldTermStructure > &  h 
)

Definition at line 255 of file indexparser.cpp.

255  {
256 
257  // Check the index string is of the required form before doing anything
258  vector<string> tokens;
259  split(tokens, s, boost::is_any_of("-"));
260  QL_REQUIRE(tokens.size() == 2 || tokens.size() == 3,
261  "Two or three tokens required in " << s << ": CCY-INDEX or CCY-INDEX-TERM");
262 
263  // Variables used below
264  string indexStem = tokens[0] + "-" + tokens[1];
265  if (tokens.size() == 3) {
266  tenor = tokens[2];
267  } else {
268  tenor = "";
269  }
270 
271  const boost::shared_ptr<Conventions>& conventions = InstrumentConventions::instance().conventions();
272  boost::shared_ptr<Convention> c;
273  if (conventions->has(s, Convention::Type::IborIndex) || conventions->has(s, Convention::Type::OvernightIndex))
274  c = conventions->get(s);
275 
276  // if we have a convention given, set up the index using this convention, this overrides the parsing from
277  // hardcoded strings below if there is an overlap
278  if (c) {
279  QL_REQUIRE(c->id() == s, "ibor index convention id ('"
280  << c->id() << "') not matching ibor index string to parse ('" << s << "'");
281  Currency ccy = parseCurrency(tokens[0]);
282  if (auto conv = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<OvernightIndexConvention>(c)) {
283  QL_REQUIRE(tenor.empty(), "no tenor allowed for convention based overnight index ('" << s << "')");
284  auto res = boost::make_shared<OvernightIndex>(tokens[0] + "-" + tokens[1], conv->settlementDays(), ccy,
285  parseCalendar(conv->fixingCalendar()),
286  parseDayCounter(conv->dayCounter()), h);
287  IndexNameTranslator::instance().add(res->name(), s);
288  return res;
289  } else if (auto conv = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<IborIndexConvention>(c)) {
290  QL_REQUIRE(!tenor.empty(), "no tenor given for convention based Ibor index ('" << s << "'");
291  auto res = boost::make_shared<IborIndex>(tokens[0] + "-" + tokens[1], parsePeriod(tenor),
292  conv->settlementDays(), ccy, parseCalendar(conv->fixingCalendar()),
293  parseBusinessDayConvention(conv->businessDayConvention()),
294  conv->endOfMonth(), parseDayCounter(conv->dayCounter()), h);
295  IndexNameTranslator::instance().add(res->name(), s);
296  return res;
297  } else {
298  QL_FAIL("invalid convention passed to parseIborIndex(): expected OvernightIndexConvention or "
299  "IborIndexConvention");
300  }
301  }
302 
303  // if we do not have a convention, look up the index in the hardcoded maps below
304 
305  // Map from our _unique internal name_ to an overnight index
306  static map<string, boost::shared_ptr<OvernightIndex>> onIndices = {
307  {"EUR-EONIA", boost::make_shared<Eonia>()},

386  {"CNY-REPOFIX", boost::make_shared<IborIndexParserWithPeriod<CNYRepoFix>>()},
387  {"USD-SOFR", boost::make_shared<IborIndexParserWithPeriod<QuantExt::SofrTerm>>()},
388  {"GBP-SONIA", boost::make_shared<IborIndexParserWithPeriod<QuantExt::SoniaTerm>>()}};
389 
390  // Check (once) that we have a one-to-one mapping
391  static bool checked = false;
392  if (!checked) {
393  checkOneToOne(onIndices, iborIndices);
394  checked = true;
395  }
396 
397  // Simple single case for USD-SIFMA (i.e. BMA)
398  if (indexStem == "USD-SIFMA") {
399  QL_REQUIRE(tenor.empty(), "A tenor is not allowed with USD-SIFMA as it is implied");
400  auto res = boost::make_shared<BMAIndexWrapper>(boost::make_shared<BMAIndex>(h));
401  IndexNameTranslator::instance().add(res->name(), s);
402  return res;
403  }
404 
405  // Ibor indices with a tenor, this includes OIS term rates like USD-SOFR-3M
406  auto it = iborIndices.find(indexStem);
407  if (it != iborIndices.end() && !tenor.empty()) {
408  Period p = parsePeriod(tenor);
409  auto res = it->second->build(p, h);
410  IndexNameTranslator::instance().add(res->name(), s);
411  return res;
412  }
413 
414  // Overnight indices
415  auto onIt = onIndices.find(indexStem);
416  if (onIt != onIndices.end()) {
417  QL_REQUIRE(tenor.empty(),
418  "A tenor is not allowed with the overnight index " << indexStem << " as it is implied");
419  auto res = onIt->second->clone(h);
420  IndexNameTranslator::instance().add(res->name(), s);
421  return res;
422  }
423 
424  // GENERIC indices
425  if (tokens[1] == "GENERIC") {
426  Period p = parsePeriod(tenor);
427  auto ccy = parseCurrency(tokens[0]);
428  auto res = boost::make_shared<GenericIborIndex>(p, ccy, h);
429  IndexNameTranslator::instance().add(res->name(), s);
430  return res;
431  }
432 
433  QL_FAIL("parseIborIndex \"" << s << "\" not recognized");
434 }

◆ parseCommodityIndex()

boost::shared_ptr<QuantExt::CommodityIndex> ore::data::parseCommodityIndex ( const string &  name,
bool  hasPrefix,
const Handle< PriceTermStructure > &  ts,
const Calendar &  cal,
const bool  enforceFutureIndex 
)

Definition at line 712 of file indexparser.cpp.

714  {
715 
716  // Whether we check for "COMM-" prefix depends on hasPrefix.
717  string commName = name;
718  if (hasPrefix) {
719  // Make sure the prefix is correct
720  string prefix = name.substr(0, 5);
721  QL_REQUIRE(prefix == "COMM-", "A commodity index string must start with 'COMM-' but got " << prefix);
722  commName = name.substr(5);
723  }
724 
725  // Now take the remainder of the string
726  // for spot indices, this should just be the commodity name (possibly containing hyphens)
727  // for future indices, this is of the form NAME-YYYY-MM or NAME-YYYY-MM-DD where NAME is the commodity name
728  // (possibly containing hyphens) and YYYY-MM(-DD) is the expiry date of the futures contract
729  Date expiry;
730 
731  // Check for form NAME-YYYY-MM-DD
732  if (commName.size() > 10) {
733  string test = commName.substr(commName.size() - 10);
734  if (boost::regex_match(test, boost::regex("\\d{4}-\\d{2}-\\d{2}"))) {
735  expiry = parseDate(test);
736  commName = commName.substr(0, commName.size() - test.size() - 1);
737  }
738  }
739 
740  // Check for form NAME-YYYY-MM if NAME-YYYY-MM-DD failed
741  if (expiry == Date() && commName.size() > 7) {
742  string test = commName.substr(commName.size() - 7);
743  if (boost::regex_match(test, boost::regex("\\d{4}-\\d{2}"))) {
744  expiry = parseDate(test + "-01");
745  commName = commName.substr(0, commName.size() - test.size() - 1);
746  }
747  }
748 
749  // Name to use when creating the index. This may be updated if we have a commodity future convention and IndexName
750  // is provided by the convention.
751  string indexName = commName;
752 
753  // Do we have a commodity future convention for the commodity.
754  boost::shared_ptr<Conventions> conventions = InstrumentConventions::instance().conventions();
755  pair<bool, boost::shared_ptr<Convention>> p = conventions->get(commName, Convention::Type::CommodityFuture);
756  boost::shared_ptr<CommodityFutureConvention> convention;
757  if (p.first) {
758 
759  convention = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<CommodityFutureConvention>(p.second);
760 
761  if (!convention->indexName().empty())
762  indexName = convention->indexName();
763 
764  // If we have provided OffPeakPowerIndexData, we use that to construct the off peak power commodity index.
765  if (convention->offPeakPowerIndexData()) {
766 
767  const auto& oppIdxData = *convention->offPeakPowerIndexData();
768 
769  if (expiry == Date()) {
770  // If expiry is still not set use any date (off peak index is calendar daily)
771  expiry = Settings::instance().evaluationDate();
772  }
773  string suffix = "-" + to_string(expiry);
774 
775  auto offPeakIndex = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<CommodityFuturesIndex>(parseCommodityIndex(
776  oppIdxData.offPeakIndex() + suffix, false));
777  auto peakIndex = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<CommodityFuturesIndex>(parseCommodityIndex(
778  oppIdxData.peakIndex() + suffix, false));
779 
780  return boost::make_shared<OffPeakPowerIndex>(indexName, expiry, offPeakIndex, peakIndex,
781  oppIdxData.offPeakHours(), oppIdxData.peakCalendar(), ts);
782  }
783  }
784 
785  // Create and return the required future index
786  if (expiry != Date() || (convention && enforceFutureIndex)) {
787 
788  // If expiry is empty, just use any valid expiry.
789  if (expiry == Date()) {
790  ConventionsBasedFutureExpiry feCalc(*convention);
791  expiry = feCalc.nextExpiry();
792  }
793 
794  bool keepDays = convention && convention->contractFrequency() == Daily;
795 
796  Calendar cdr = cal;
797  if (convention && cdr == NullCalendar()) {
798  cdr = convention->calendar();
799  }
800 
801  return boost::make_shared<CommodityFuturesIndex>(indexName, expiry, cdr, keepDays, ts);
802 
803  } else {
804  return boost::make_shared<CommoditySpotIndex>(commName, cal, ts);
805  }
806 }

◆ getStartAndLag()

std::pair< QuantLib::Date, QuantLib::Period > getStartAndLag ( const QuantLib::Date &  asof,
const InflationSwapConvention &  conv 
)

Definition at line 10 of file inflationstartdate.cpp.

11  {
12 
13  using IPR = InflationSwapConvention::PublicationRoll;
14 
15  // If no roll schedule, just return (as of, convention's obs lag).
16  if (conv.publicationRoll() == IPR::None) {
17  return make_pair(asof, Period());
18  }
19 
20  // If there is a publication roll, call getStart to retrieve the date.
21  Date d = getInflationSwapStart(asof, conv);
22 
23  // Date in inflation period related to the inflation index value.
24  Date dateInPeriod = d - Period(conv.index()->frequency());
25 
26  // Find period between dateInPeriod and asof. This will be the inflation curve's obsLag.
27  QL_REQUIRE(dateInPeriod < asof, "InflationCurve: expected date in inflation period ("
28  << io::iso_date(dateInPeriod) << ") to be before the as of date ("
29  << io::iso_date(asof) << ").");
30  Period curveObsLag = (asof - dateInPeriod) * Days;
31 
32  return make_pair(d, curveObsLag);
33 }

◆ getInflationSwapStart() [2/2]

QuantLib::Date getInflationSwapStart ( const QuantLib::Date &  asof,
const InflationSwapConvention &  conv 
)

Definition at line 35 of file inflationstartdate.cpp.

35  {
36 
37  using IPR = InflationSwapConvention::PublicationRoll;
38 
39  // If no roll schedule, just return (as of, convention's obs lag).
40  if (conv.publicationRoll() == IPR::None) {
41  return asof;
42  }
43 
44  // Get schedule and check not empty
45  const Schedule& ps = conv.publicationSchedule();
46  QL_REQUIRE(!ps.empty(), "InflationCurve: roll on publication is true for "
47  << conv.id() << " but the publication schedule is empty.");
48 
49  // Check the schedule dates cover the as of date.
50  const vector<Date>& ds = ps.dates();
51  QL_REQUIRE(ds.front() < asof, "InflationCurve: first date in the publication schedule ("
52  << io::iso_date(ds.front()) << ") should be before the as of date ("
53  << io::iso_date(asof) << ").");
54  QL_REQUIRE(asof < ds.back(), "InflationCurve: last date in the publication schedule ("
55  << io::iso_date(ds.back()) << ") should be after the as of date ("
56  << io::iso_date(asof) << ").");
57 
58  // Find d such that d_- < asof <= d. If necessary, move to the next publication schedule date. We
59  // know that there is another date because asof < ds.back() is checked above.
60  auto it = lower_bound(ds.begin(), ds.end(), asof);
61  Date d = *it;
62  if (asof == d && conv.publicationRoll() == IPR::OnPublicationDate) {
63  d = *next(it);
64  }
65 
66  // Move d back availability lag and the 15th of that month is the helper's start date.
67  // Note: the 15th of the month is specific to AU CPI. We may need to generalise later.
68  d -= conv.index()->availabilityLag();
69 
70  return Date(15, d.month(), d.year());
71 }

◆ xccyCurveName()

std::string xccyCurveName ( const std::string &  ccyCode)

For a given currency code, ccyCode, return the internal name for the cross currency based yield curve.

For a given currency code, ccyCode, this function returns __XCCY__-ccyCode. This curve, if available, is currently used in special cases to allow for separate discount curves when discounting the cashflows on cross currency interest rate swaps.

Definition at line 39 of file marketdata.cpp.

39 { return xccyCurveNamePrefix + "-" + ccyCode; }
Here is the caller graph for this function:

◆ xccyYieldCurve() [1/2]

Handle< YieldTermStructure > xccyYieldCurve ( const boost::shared_ptr< Market > &  market,
const std::string &  ccyCode,
const std::string &  configuration = Market::defaultConfiguration 
)

Attempt to return a yield curve from the market using the name generated by xccyCurveName(ccyCode). If no yield curve is available, return the discount curve for the given currency code, ccyCode.

Get a Xccy curve from given a market

43  bool dummy;

◆ xccyYieldCurve() [2/2]

QuantLib::Handle< QuantLib::YieldTermStructure > xccyYieldCurve ( const boost::shared_ptr< Market > &  market,
const std::string &  ccyCode,
bool &  outXccyExists,
const std::string &  configuration = Market::defaultConfiguration 
)

Attempt to return a yield curve from the market using the name generated by xccyCurveName(ccyCode). If no yield curve is available, return the discount curve for the given currency code, ccyCode. The parameter outXccyExists is populated with true if a yield curve was found under xccyCurveName(ccyCode) and it is populated with false if there was no such yield curve.

Definition at line 47 of file marketdata.cpp.

48  {
49 
50  Handle<YieldTermStructure> curve;
51  string xccyCurve = xccyCurveName(ccyCode);
52  outXccyExists = true;
53  try {
54  curve = market->yieldCurve(xccyCurve, configuration);
55  } catch (const Error&) {
56  DLOG("Could not link " << ccyCode << " termstructure to cross currency yield curve " << xccyCurve
57  << " so just using " << ccyCode << " discount curve.");
58  curve = market->discountCurve(ccyCode, configuration);
59  outXccyExists = false;
60  }
61 
62  return curve;
63 }
Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ prettyPrintInternalCurveName()

std::string prettyPrintInternalCurveName ( std::string  name)

Pretty print an internal curve name occuring (once or several times) in a string (e.g. in a risk factor name).

Definition at line 100 of file marketdata.cpp.

100  {
101  std::size_t pos = 0;
102  bool found;
103  do {
104  found = false;
105  std::size_t pos2 = name.find("__SECCRCRV_", pos);
106  if (pos2 != std::string::npos) {
107  std::size_t pos3 = name.find("_&_", pos2);
108  if (pos3 != std::string::npos) {
109  std::size_t pos4 = name.find("_&_", pos3 + 3);
110  if (pos4 != std::string::npos) {
111  name.replace(pos2, pos4 + 3 - pos2,
112  name.substr(pos2 + 11, pos3 - (pos2 + 11)) + "(" +
113  name.substr(pos3 + 3, pos4 - (pos3 + 3)) + ")");
114  pos = pos + (pos4 - pos2 - 12);
115  found = true;
116  }
117  }
118  }
119  } while (found);
120  return name;
121 }

◆ getFxIndexConventions()

std::pair< Natural, Calendar > getFxIndexConventions ( const string &  index)

Definition at line 146 of file marketdata.cpp.

146  {
147  // can take an fx index or ccy pair e.g. EURUSD
148  string ccy1, ccy2;
149  string fixingSource;
150  if (isFxIndex(index)) {
151  auto ind = parseFxIndex(index);
152  ccy1 = ind->sourceCurrency().code();
153  ccy2 = ind->targetCurrency().code();
154  fixingSource = ind->familyName();
155  } else {
156  QL_REQUIRE(index.size() == 6, "getFxIndexConventions: index must be an FXIndex of form FX-ECB-EUR-USD, "
157  << "or a currency pair e.g. EURUSD.");
158  ccy1 = index.substr(0, 3);
159  ccy2 = index.substr(3);
160  fixingSource = "GENERIC";
161  }
162 
163  if (ccy1 == ccy2)
164  return std::make_pair(0, NullCalendar());
165 
166  const boost::shared_ptr<Conventions>& conventions = InstrumentConventions::instance().conventions();
167  boost::shared_ptr<Convention> con;
168  // first look for the index and inverse index directly
169  try {
170  con = conventions->get("FX-" + fixingSource + "-" + ccy1 + "-" + ccy2);
171  } catch (...) {
172  }
173  if (con == nullptr) {
174  try {
175  con = conventions->get("FX-" + fixingSource + "-" + ccy2 + "-" + ccy1);
176  } catch (...) {
177  }
178  }
179  // then by currency pair and inverse currency pair (getFxConvention() handles both)
180  if (con == nullptr) {
181  try {
182  con = conventions->getFxConvention(ccy1, ccy2);
183  } catch (...) {
184  }
185  }
186  if (auto fxCon = boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<FXConvention>(con)) {
187  TLOG("getFxIndexConvention(" << index << "): " << fxCon->spotDays() << " / " << fxCon->advanceCalendar().name()
188  << " from convention.");
189  return std::make_pair(fxCon->spotDays(), fxCon->advanceCalendar());
190  }
191 
192  // default calendar for pseudo currencies is USD
193  if (isPseudoCurrency(ccy1))
194  ccy1 = "USD";
195  if (isPseudoCurrency(ccy2))
196  ccy2 = "USD";
197 
198  try {
199  Calendar cal = parseCalendar(ccy1 + "," + ccy2);
200  TLOG("getFxIndexConvention(" << index << "): 2 (default) / " << cal.name()
201  << " (from ccys), no convention found.");
202  return std::make_pair(2, cal);
203  } catch (const std::exception& e) {
204  ALOG("could not get fx index convention for '" << index << "': " << e.what() << ", continue with 'USD'");
205  }
206  TLOG("getFxIndexConvention(" << index
207  << "): 2 (default) / USD (default), no convention found, could not parse calendar '"
208  << (ccy1 + "," + ccy2) << "'");
209  return std::make_pair(2, parseCalendar("USD"));
210 }
Here is the call graph for this function:
Here is the caller graph for this function:

◆ splitCurveIdWithTenor()

std::pair< std::string, QuantLib::Period > splitCurveIdWithTenor ( const std::string &  curveId)

Split curve name NAME_5Y into (NAME, 5Y), the period can be empty if not given

Definition at line 212 of file marketdata.cpp.

212  {
213  Size pos = creditCurveId.rfind("_");
214  if (pos != std::string::npos) {
215  Period term;
216  string termString = creditCurveId.substr(pos + 1, creditCurveId.length());
217  if (tryParse<Period>(termString, term, parsePeriod)) {
218  return make_pair(creditCurveId.substr(0, pos), term);
219  }
220  }
221  return make_pair(creditCurveId, 0 * Days);
222 }

◆ indexCdsDefaultCurve()

QuantLib::Handle< QuantExt::CreditCurve > indexCdsDefaultCurve ( const boost::shared_ptr< Market > &  market,
const std::string &  creditCurveId,
const std::string &  config 
)

Get default curve for index cds from market:

  • if creditCurveId ends on _5Y (or any other term), use that to get the curve from the market
  • if such a curve is not available, fall back to creditCurveId without that suffix

Definition at line 224 of file marketdata.cpp.

226  {
227  try {
228  return market->defaultCurve(creditCurveId, config);

231  }
232 
233  auto p = splitCurveIdWithTenor(creditCurveId);
234  return market->defaultCurve(p.first, config);

◆ isOnePeriod()

bool isOnePeriod ( const string &  s)

return true if s represents a period of the form [0-9]D|W|M|Y

Definition at line 155 of file parsers.cpp.

155  {
156  if (s.empty())
157  return false;
158  char c = std::toupper(s.back());
159  if (!(c == 'D' || c == 'W' || c == 'M' || c == 'Y'))
160  return false;
161  for (auto c = s.cbegin(); c != std::next(s.end(), -1); std::advance(c, 1))
162  if (*c < '0' || *c > '9')
163  return false;
164  return true;
165 }

1152  {Rounding::Type::Floor, "Floor"},
1153  {Rounding::Type::Ceiling, "Ceiling"}};
1154  auto it = m.find(t);
1155  if (it != m.end()) {
1156  return os << it->second;
1157  } else {
1158  QL_FAIL("Internal error: unknown Rounding::Type - check implementation of operator<< "
1159  "for this enum");
1160  }
1161 }

1195  {
1196  if (p == QuantExt::BondIndex::PriceQuoteMethod::PercentageOfPar)
1197  os << "PercentageOfPar";
1198  else if (p == QuantExt::BondIndex::PriceQuoteMethod::CurrencyPerUnit)

1200  else
1201  os << "Unknown PriceQuoteMethod (" << static_cast<int>(p) << ")";

◆ getCorrelationTokens()

std::vector< std::string > getCorrelationTokens ( const std::string &  name)

Helper function to get the two tokens in a correlation name Index2:Index1.

Definition at line 1205 of file parsers.cpp.

1205  {
1206  // Look for & first as it avoids collisions with : which can be used in an index name
1207  // if it is not there we fall back on the old behaviour
1208  string delim;
1209  if (name.find('&') != std::string::npos)
1210  delim = "&";
1211  else
1212  delim = "/:,";
1213  vector<string> tokens;
1214  boost::split(tokens, name, boost::is_any_of(delim));
1215  QL_REQUIRE(tokens.size() == 2,
1216  "invalid correlation name '" << name << "', expected Index2:Index1 or Index2/Index1 or Index2&Index1");
1217  return tokens;
1218 }
Here is the caller graph for this function:
